description:
There's only one reason why I come here:
Vanilla Rose Latte.
Fragrant, frothy, and delicious.
author: Lee N.

description:
First time stopping by this coffee shop two weeks ago. I grabbed an iced green tea and worked here for a bit. I would say this is probably the best coffee shop to work out of in the Glen Park downtown neighborhood area; on a Saturday morning there was a steady stream of customers coming in and out, but it never felt overcrowded. They have free Wi-Fi here. It's not super quiet here because the nearby intersection can be quite busy and the door is left open, but grab a pair of headphones and you'll be good. Also, sometimes ambient sound can be soothing, right?

This place is also walking distance from Glen Park BART, in case you don't live in the neighborhood! (though in that case, why are you really coming to Glen Park, lol - not to say you shouldn't, though - it's cute) I don't actually end up in downtown Glen Park too often unless I'm headed to the BART, but if I'm looking for a good local coffee shop to work out of for a bit because I want to get out of the house, Bello is a solid choice.
author: Brian W.

description:
I had been buying gift cards for my bed and breakfast for a couple of years at Bello.  The lovely owner Jane was offering me a gratis beverage of my choice whenever I bought a card of around $20 value. 

Then her husband got really cheap with me and said I could only have a small coffee for these purchases.  So I stopped for a while.  That was big turnoff to me as a very small business owner myself, trying to support a neighborhood business.  

I recently took up the practice of gifting my guests again with gift cards, and the husband again got rude and belligerent with me yesterday.  It took him so long to figure out my gift card balance, and then to add the remaining value to the card that I wished to purchase, that I asked him if I should wait as he told me a line was forming.  Well, I was purchasing a $15 gift card!  He asked me what I wanted and I said a small mocha.  I thought he was gifting that to me for my purchase.  I told him that, and he said "No."  I told him there was no line behind me and he said, "They cannot wait.  They left already."

I'll try to spend as little as possible here in the future and no more gift cards!
author: Leslie G.

description:
What I liked:
- owner is very friendly (and, he was operating a 1 man coffee shop when I was here) 
- good coffee (smooth and balanced; not too strong, acidic, or bland
- music is not too loud or disturbing, great for studying 

This will officially be my go to coffee shop for studying or meeting up with a friend when I'm in the Glen Park area
author: Erica M.

description: Very distinguished drinks here. Friendly staff and even though it's morning time, they still start conversations and aren't grumpy. I tried their hot lavender white mocha; the lavender is not too strong, but I can definitely taste it in my palate. Fast service and I enjoy every sip of the drink.
author: Vanessa L.

description: I like this cafe. It can get overcrowded after work hours. I like the bake goods and their lavender white mocha . Good place in Glen Park.
author: Juan V.

description:
I've been going to this place before or after I hop on BART because it's so close. 

Weekend mornings I have found the place to be pretty low key. The ambiance is very relaxed and there seems to be enough seating for the amount of people that wanted to stay in and work on something. They have chargers for people to be able to charge their phones which has  been extremely helpful as I often find my phone battery dying as I'm navigating the city.

The uniqueness of their drinks is my personal favorite thing about it. My usual go-to is the Vanilla Rose Latte. It gives a you sweet but not too over-powerful drink. Another close second is the Lavender White Mocha. Sometimes the barista mixes it well but I often find that I need to mix it on my own to make sure the unique flavor isn't just sitting on the bottom.
author: Stephen P.

description:
Conservative vibe.
Immaculate cup + design = they like you.
Stained cup / sleeve + no design = they don't like you.

Try the Vanilla Rose Latte; the Rose Black Tea; the Nitro Coffee.
Great location - near the Library and across from BART. Spacious bathroom. Good music. Be a considerate patron and take your phone call outside.
author: Antonia R.

description:
TL;DR good coffee, right next to Glen Park BART Station 

Very cute cafe, dim lighting, with nice simple decor. There's a library right next door, but this is a better working/reading environment. The latte was 5/5, not acidic, and milk steamed perfectly. Prices are not bad compared to other SF cafes, $3 for a small good quality latte. Most people here were on their laptops, so I presume there's wifi, password somewhere at the counter.
author: Sophia L.

description:
They call it mellow Bello
(Quite rightly)
They call it mellow Bello
(Quite rightly)

Call me Donovan and put flowers in my hair. Anyway, when you get off BART at Glen Park, I think you must be either going home or eating at one of the restaurants on Diamond. It's a low-profile 'hood, nothing like the Mission stops or Balboa Park either, and I'm sure that's the way the residents like it. Me too as sometimes I randomly get off at Glen Park just to find something to eat, shop at Canyon Market, or, you guessed it, have a cup of joe here. It's a good place to hang for a while if the seats are not all taken, which on Saturday afternoons, is often the case.

I've been a couple of times now, and I ordered the $4.20 Vanilla Rose Latte both times, quite a luscious elixir and not too sweet (photo: http://bit.ly/2hiKkct). The coffee beans appear to be their own and are roasted daily. The result is smooth without being too aggressive. They definitely have the standard cafe pastries in case your sweet tooth isn't completely satisfied with your libation of choice. Mine was though. Maybe not as satisfying is the service. Just a bit on the curt side for such a neighborhood-feeling cafe if you ask me.

COFFEE - 4 stars....a fine find in the Vanilla Rose Latte
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...relaxing...if you can find an empty chair
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...service with a smile would be nice
TOTAL - 4 stars...quite rightly mellow Bello to be found in Glen Park
author: Ed U.

description: Its a good spot in Glen Park .i had a Gibraltar and my husband had a macchiato.the coffee was not good.The Person who made the coffee was rude.not going to this place again.there was seating for sure.you can take your dog there and relax.no one seemed to be talking to each other.super quiet place.
author: Prerna M.

description: Stopped in Bello to grab a latte and to meet a colleague for a short chat. Grabbed a chocolate chip cookie too while waiting for him to arrive. Tasty latte! Decent cookie. Small and clean place. I'd stop in again and try other drinks and snacks when I'm in the hood.
author: Ali M.

description: Great coffee shop near the Glen Park Bart station! I wanted to explore this area again since I used to come to this area when I was younger and I wanted to see what has changed/stayed the same. Not sure if I remember this coffee shop years ago, but I'm glad I stumbled upon it! I came here on a Sunday at around 8:30am, and the place was bustling. There were 2 workers (one cashier/pastry server and the other was the coffee maker), and even though it was just them to, the service was quick and efficient. I was debating whether to get the vanilla rose latte or the lavender white mocha and I opted for the lavender white mocha which was DELICIOUS. The lavender flavor was really pronounced but not overpowering, just enough flavor to make you really notice it. Overall, this is a great place to grab a coffee or a quick bite to eat (pastries wise), and I will definitely come back to try the vanilla rose latte!
author: Lisa C.

description: Really quaint coffee place. Idk why there are so many hateful photos of the place as it was really nice environment in glen park. Right next to the Bart but they do take a while to make your drink so if you're in a hurry, I wouldn't recommend it. I got the green tea latte and it wasn't that great but the reviews for the environment which is awesome!
author: Navdeep D.

description:
One of the local coffee places in Glen Park. The space is fairly open, I have only visited on the weekend and there are normally tables free but still a steady flow of customers.

The cappuccinos lack smoothness and richness but they are still okay. I haven't tried any other drinks. I also had a chocolate chip cookie, a bit tough and not that exciting.

That said the service is friendly and normally pretty speedy, also in a very convenient space so I will be back.
author: Tristan L.

description: My go to coffee spot. It's out of my way but I come back anytime I have free time. The best plain coffee hands down. Never burnt or watery. So much flavor!
author: Alex B.

description:
Tried the place out since they offer coconut milk as an alternative. I'm lactose-intolerant and allergic to soy and almond (I don't know what brought upon this curse) so I'm always excited when coconut milk is an option. 

The actual drink is good; I got the vanilla rose latte with coconut milk (small aka: 12 oz. for $4.78). It was 50 cents for any alternative milk option (soy, half and half, almond, coconut). 

The only reason it's not a 5 star review is service. I'm not a stickler, but dude was cordial only to the patrons before and after me (small talk, suggestions, obvious shift in tone). I wanted to make sure this vanilla rose latte didn't have other ingredients containing milk, but the middle-aged Asian man taking the order was obviously bothered that I didn't just choose a different milk option. I even clarified that I wanted to make sure that there was no milk, since their lavender white mocha would have milk in it, but he treated me like an imbecile. He also gave me two cents less in change, so here they are. 

If service isn't a factor, I'd def be back. But I think I'll continue exploring.
author: Jennifer A.

description: This place is great! It's spacious and low key enough that it wasn't to busy on a Saturday morning and it was just a block away from our air bnb!
author: Taylor N.

description:
cute lil' coffee shoppe in glen park that caters to an eclectic mix of coffee drinkers.  i met up with a friend since this location seemed to have decent parking (i parked 2 blocks away in a 2 hr zone) and is literally just across the st from the glen park bart.

they have the usual variety of coffee and tea drinks, as well as juices and smoothies.  as expected from a small, independent, non-franchise coffee shoppe, they also had a selection of sandwiches, salads, and pastries for those who need a little something to eat with their beverage.

on a saturday afternoon, we were pretty lucky to get a table for 2, and be able to sit for a couple of hours, sipping tea, and just catching up, chatting away.  the noise level wasn't bad at all, despite the fact that it was a pretty packed house, and also near a busy intersection.  the restroom in the rear was reasonably clean, which was a good thing since i used it at least twice!  staff was pretty friendly and laid back, something i appreciate in a busy city.

good location and option for an afternoon meeting, just don't come too late since they close @ 1900.
author: Ellen L.

description: Cozy atmosphere and delicious coffee. Love the mellow vibes coming from the music down low. The vanilla rose latte is bomb
author: Nicole B.

description: The lavender white mocha is KILLER!!! The ambiance was lovely, super mellow and still hip! I felt inclined to take pictures of the cold press coffee machine but folded. Everyone was friendly and said HELLO! I'm a fan of kindness. Go for it!
author: Karalyn P.

description: "We're out of cream." I've been staying with my friend in Glen Park as I return to the US after being out of the country and have been going to Bello every day. Today I went in and asked if there was any cream. The girl working behind the counter said "we're out of cream" in a bit of an annoyed tone. Now I get that you run out of cream, it happens. The lack of creativity in resolving it is pretty epic though. There is a store about a 15 second walk away that has cream. The girl saw the smirk on my face and thought it was because they were out of cream. All I could think was "nice problem solving skills." And it wasn't like she was working alone so nobody could go - there were four or five people working. I'm going to try the place down the street tomorrow. Weak.
author: Andy M.

description: Love the vanila rose latte and the ambiance in here is great too. Usually seating in the mornings, never too much of a line and the drinks are great.
author: Meg M.

description:
I've been to Bello many times. None were particularly remarkable except for the beautiful rainbows that fall across the countertop in the evening sunlight - the result of a well-placed, beautiful coffee contraption in the window. I've lived in San Francisco for a long time, so I'm used to rude service being trendy... but I have never had a cordial interaction with any of their employees. The coffee is okay, but I had a bad enough experience there to officially review this place as just "meh."

We are vegan, and my daughter likes to sip a steamed soy milk while my husband and I drink our cup'o. As we were ordering, the guy behind the counter was way more interested in telling his coworker a story than acknowledging our existence. I told him "soy" two times because I didn't want him to ignore this particular detail - our order wasn't complicated, just two coffees and the kid's steamer. Sure enough my daughter took one sip and looked at me in horror as she blurted out "what is this?!" I opened the lid and it was unmistakably as white as you would expect pus-infused calf hormone growth formula to be. I was angry but calm when I told him I'd asked for soy and he'd given my child cow juice. His first reaction was defense, saying he'd given me soy, but when he looked for himself he did rescind. "Oh yeah, hope she's not allergic!" was his fake-jovial reply. SMH. This guy is a jerk. My daughter burst out crying and apologizing to the cows.... She was 2 - a 2 year old with more compassion than the guy working there. Ugh, now I get my coffee from Canyon Market. The only reason for two stars instead of one is that fortunately he's not the one working there.
author: Laura M.

description:
Terrible customer service! They are rude and will reuse the same coffee if it's not made to order. I won't be back but I'll make sure I have my drink remade, watch you make it and drink it here since I paid for it.
I would love to speak to the manager about their rude behavior. I sat there working and to myself, and they talked bout me loudly between themselves about tme while I was still in the cafe. I confronted them and the supervisor said I was rude to her associate, so she was talking about it. T I wanted to storm off but I stayed to make a point. I'm not a scared or a coward to just leave. I'll look you in the eye and drink my coffee. I would like the manager to call me back, and hope he can talk to his employees and teach them how a thing or two about customer service.
author: Sbeen A.

description:
They accept credit cards, as in Square! That, is a huge score on Diamond St. Believe me.

Not a big pastry selection, but they offer savory treats that can be warmed up for ya.

Yummy caffeination options, like their tasty lavender white mocha.

Great location. Fast service.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
This coffee shop is conveniently located right next to the fabulous Canyon Market, so its perfect to grab a cup of Lavender White Mocha after some grocery shopping. That drink is SO PERFECT that I haven't ever wanted to order anything else. Their breakfast items are definitely filling as well, and I always have to keep myself from ordering them since I always come from Canyon and already have a bag full of food. 

TIP: If you want a more caffeinated latte make sure to order additional shots of espresso because the larger sizes still have the same amounts of espresso (2), but just more milk. Luckily I've been told by the barista before ordering my large, and just decided to always get the regular size to get a more concentrated dose of coffee.
author: Cindy C.

description: My new favorite place to get that way to early to be awake coffee!  I just happened apon it. Lucy has given me a new meaning to "I Love Lucy". She and the young man are way on top of it and both are happy and inviting. I had an Almond Late it was as delicious  Definitely will be spreading the word. Thank You and Cheers!
author: Cemone B.

description:
The coffee is good but the guy behind the counter is a jerk. A grandmother came in while I was enjoying my coffee. She had two small children with her. The kids were confused because Bello has small, medium, large and kids sizes. She ordered a small, one of the kids said, "No, we get this one, and went around the counter (no more than a foot in) to point and the guy at the counter said, "You stay on your side!" Then, the kids went to point at which baked good they wanted and again, stepped every so slightly around the counter and the worker got stern with them again. 

Customer service and just plain tact is seriously lacking for this guy. 

I will not be back.
author: Susan C.

description:
This place makes a sincere effort, but honestly, at the very least a coffee shop should serve decent coffee...had maybe the worst americano I've ever had...all the while being subjected to a brutal (and surprisingly loud) playlist of cheesy EDM and Dubstep...at 7am...

The staff are polite and friendly, but give off the vibe of college kids working a summer job...

I want to like this place more than I do...advice to management: I'm all for letting your baristas choose the music that plays, but honestly, have some standards...decide wether you are a neighborhood coffee shop or a Forever 21...
author: Mike W.

description: I only ever come here to get their iced vanilla rose latte because I can't stand any other place's vanilla latte. For someone who's accustomed to the sweetness of milk tea, their vanilla rose latte really hits the spot. The staff are accommodating if you want to use your own cup or use a different type of milk. The baristas do work alone so it's best to be patient.
author: Victoria H.

description:
Chill little coffee place in the glen park district. It was my first time coming here. When i came here to meet a friend to catch up, good among of people walk and in out of this place. Seems popular to the local. 

Anyways, i got the ice tea of green tea for $2.35. Price was cheap since the cup they give you was pretty big. It was more like medium to large. Since it wasnt too busy when i order my drink, they made my drink really quick. It has that strong bitter taste of the tea.

Friendly staff. Cool place to come if you want to grab a quick drink or hang out
author: Julie N.

description: Just discovered this little gem in Glen Park.  Cool, quiet music, quality caffeinated beverages and pastries, free WiFi and an owner who does it all by himself with a smile.
author: Fabrice H.

description: I walk by this place all the time and it looked nice enough so today I stopped in and it was pretty underwhelming. Over priced, pretty bad coffee, and an unfriendly (that's me being generous) barrister. First and last time for me, but hey you might have better luck.
author: Afaan N.

description:
This place is so conveniently nearby when you hop off the Glen Park stop on the Bart. This area in general is a wonderful location because of all the amazing shops. I have to admit, reading all the reviews about this place about how bad the service is and how rude the guys are I was a bit intimidated. But I thought what the heck, majority of the ratings are positive so I had to try it out myself. Walking into the place, there's a lot of seating for those who want to drink some coffee and get work done. I was one of those people. I ordered a cappuccino with a brownie. It wasn't anything too special. Just a typical drink and snack. They have a pretty straight forward menu which is kinda nice cause you're not too overwhelmed with a whole bunch of options. 

After my experience with this place, I'd have to agree with some reviews. The workers aren't the happiest but what does that matter? As long as they make your order and your order is to how you want it to be. After that you can decide to stay and grab seat and enjoy your drink or you can leave and not come back. But this place is definitely worth a try. I might come back whenever I'm in need for a coffee or bite to eat.  Overall it's a decent enough place to grab coffee, snack, sit & chill.
author: Donna H.

description:
Bello is a pretty good coffee shop located conveniently right across the street frmo the Glen Park BART station. The shop is well-decorated and has plenty of tables.

The coffee is definitely good. I've had quite a number of things here since I commute via Glen Park station and often find myself needing a bit more coffee before I get on the train to work. I knock off a star because I find Bello to be a bit overpriced, and the service a little iffy, and perhaps because the owner seems to be pretty ambitious when it comes to making it trendy - it seems like more is spent on decorating than the staff sometimes.
author: Jesse C.

description:
I love the consistent service, and quality of their coffee.   Cafe Bello is across the street from Glen Park BART, conveniently located right by the 280.  

You feel comfortable coming into this spot, good lighting,  4 comfy love seats, good tunes, and rotating art work on display/for sale.  The employees are nice, and they are quick.

This place roasts their own coffee beans, has a wide variety of loose leaf teas, and makes a great latte.  The pastry display case has your usual muffins, biscotti, cookies as well as vegetarian pizzas, quiches, and bagels.  

If you're in the Glen Park area, you should definitely stop by for some coffee or tea.  Their iced coffee or iced teas are also good.  You will not be disappointed!
author: Marlon T.

description: Back in the day this coffee was way too strong for me. However, now it is perfect for my tender palette. Bello roasts their own coffee and offers almond and coconut milk. The coconut milk cappuccino with sugar free vanilla is divine. I've had it twice now in the last few days and I definitely like supporting local small business as opposed to big corporate chains. Plus they still do coffee art which is a fun touch.
author: Justine D.

description:
As a Glen Park resident, I happened to want a neighborhood, sit-down coffee this morning.  The angry looking thirty-something Caucasian guy at the counter was RUDE and unfriendly, got my order wrong (left it in the microwave), unapologetic, stressed -- and I left knowing with full conviction that Canyon (friendly, nice, appreciative) is where I'll go from here on out. 
Sadly, to add insult to injury, when I approached the (Asian) owner, his response was: "what did he do to you?" It's more about what he didn't do, but I didn't have time to explain basic customer service.  Rude boy never cracked a smile, no greeting, nothing -- and his "for here or to go" was angsty and abrupt..... And it wasn't even that crowded.  It's unfortunate that small business owners don't realize the importance of friendly, appreciative, customer service.  It's so basic. Back to Canyon Market for keeps.
author: Susie S.

description:
The coffee is simply outstanding. The worker solidarity is even better. Always enjoy the people working there, great for conversation and have always had outstanding customer service.

Also has the best cold brew in the state (if not the coast or country).
author: Joe E.

description: Completely infatuated with this lavender white chocolate mocha. My boyfriend just took me here. Definitely coming back. Tell all my friends about this place.
author: Sasha M.

description:
I usually get the green tea latte and a bagel for $6.00.  Sometimes I get a Cold Brew for $3.50

Fast service and great coffee.  My new morning spot :)
author: Angelica C.

description:
Friendly staff. Nice ambiance. Chill neighborhood coffee spot. 

I only wish they would step it up a half notch to the quality of Ritual, 4-barrel, or Sight-glass. Years ago (maybe 2003) they had the best capps, then they fell behind as the bar raised substantially. Sure a few people who are use to drinking the 1990s style big capp would be upset at first, but quickly they would never look back. 

Maybe they need a new machine? I would invest... 

In-doubt-ably, there would be a line out front of this place if they followed this advice. The workers would be happier because the place would be hipper. Its a win-win.
author: H K.

description:
Bello is located super close to the Glen Park BART station, so I almost always will make a stop here if I'm in the neighborhood. It's a small coffee shop with some areas to sit. I am a fan of their vanilla rose latte and green tea latte. Definitely recommend this spot if you're looking for some good caffeinated drinks and a place to sit and chit chat with friends. 

(35/100)
author: Cassy H.

description:
This update is exclusively for the Iced White Mocha with Whip Cream. It is definitely a refreshing beverage so I'll definitely order this beverage again.

Friendly staff and service is good so this is also one coffee shop worth visiting.

EDIT FOR 10/1/2013:
The Iced Mocha with Whip Cream plus a Toasted Sesame Bagel with Cream Cheese is my new favorite combo. Every time I am in this area and need a cup of coffee or espresso, I'd make a stop here. The staff here are friendly and service is efficient. They are right by the BART Station, so you can come in here to get your morning pastry and coffee before getting on BART.

REVISION - 3/25/2014:
Large White Mocha with Whip Cream, Toasted Bagel with Grape Jelly and Strawberry Jam - absolutely delicious. Clean decent sized coffee shop, friendly staff members and good services!

EDIT FOR 12/20/2015:
I love the breakfast wraps (burritos) they offer. This and a freshly brewed cup of coffee - perfect combo for cold rainy days. As always, Bello Coffee & Tea is here for you when in need of a cup of coffee or tea or even a pastry before getting on BART or MUNI. Overall, I enjoyed the services I received here.
author: Bennett W.

description: Cute, laid back spot to enjoy your cup of coffee. It's quiet in here too, so u can enjoy your quiet time here. A cup of coffee is a little over $2, which is reasonable.
author: Tashnuva E.

description: I suggest cup right around the corner. Totally impersonal, rude, inconsiderate, slammed my money on the table. I've been there on numerous occasions when they cracked jokes upon customers after the customers left. Lady at counter is always complaining of how bad a day she is having. She should leave her problems at home. Cup they respect you and treat you with respect. Its like night and day. Descent coffee horrible service.
author: Cutty M.

description: This isn't exactly a destination spot but if you are passing through Glen Park, it's a great spot to stop for a drink and/or a snack. The thing I like most about this place is the high quality tea varieties and the fact that they serve loose leaf tea by the pot whereas most places serve tea only by the bag. Also, it's got a high quality atmosphere and can be a good spot for concentrating as it not a loud room. Downside is that it is often crowded and finding a seat can be challenging.
author: Jason S.

description:
I'm a lavender lover and this place scores major points for strong lavender flavors that come through in the decaf lavender white mocha. At many a joint, lavender flavored items always somehow fall short for me - weak or nonexistent in floral aroma and flavor. Bello doesn't disappoint. Overall very smooth and delicious afternoon beverage. 

The space itself is just the right size for a cafe - not too big and not too small. Warm colored walls and a fun cold brew machine as decor. Plenty of seating options - stools at a bar/near the window, tables, comfy looking armchairs. The BART (Glen Park) is also conveniently located a 30 second walk away. 

Good prices for specialty drinks (a 20oz lavender white mocha is only $5!) whereas most cafes I go to charge $5 for a regular latte. Fast and friendly service.

Worth a stop!
author: Thanh L.

description: Great little cafe near BART station. Highly recommend it. Grub a cup of coffee and head out to the Glen Canyon Park or just hang around in the coffee shot and order a slice of quiche. Either way, you will not be disappointed.
author: Leo V.

description:
Prittttyyy good coffee in Glen Park, right across the Baaaart station. The seating is kind of dated but whatever, at least they serve better coffee and tea than *bucks. 

I usually get this citrus jasmine something blah tea. It has a sweet flavor to it but its not overwhelming, the hot water could take a cold shower though. Jesus what is with hot water being hell water? They also have this cupcake pastry which has a cheesecake like feel to it (arteries will clog up). This place also has good music.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
Dont get me wrong, when I use to have my mochas, Bello can do no wrong. They pump my plastic cup with what looked like a continuous waterfall of chocolate syrup. The milk and tiny hint of coffee flavor from the espresso mixed beautifully. I felt as if I was drinking a liquified candy bar.

But now times achangin'. I only drink my coffee black and I was just not as impressed. The black coffee is good but there was a everlasting sour taste that lingered on the back of my tongue.
I gave their iced coffee (with no ice because they didn't have any) and it's equally as sour. I know some people may say that the sour taste is natural due to the coffee sitting out blah blah blah but this is a sour taste that I'm unfamiliar with and I don't plan on getting use to. Overall it's a personal preference. Might add soy next time
author: Linda K.

description:
Been here several times over the years so this review represents a span of a few years. 

Coffee: Simply put the coffee is fantastic. They roast onsite and it's fresh. I go for an Americano and they pour it well. Consistently good coffee - Five stars. 

Service: Simply put it sucks. Encountered the same cashier twice and both times dude was rude (white kid, curly hair, early 20's, and often wearing a beanie). How rude? Second visit, I walk up to the counter and he stares at me. So we stand there staring at each other for like four seconds (count to four yourself and imagine someone staring right back at you) and I finally say "Hello" and I get a blank "hey" in return. I proceed with my order and he rings me up. I have fifty cents in change and he drops it into my open hand. WTF!! Place it into my hand you flippin ingrate. Zero Stars

The avg of 5 is 2.5 and I'm deducting .5 bc my first experience with this kid wasn't much better. 

As a result of this experience, I was forced to look for an alternative and found Cafe XO not far away on Church St. Baristas and servers are uber nice and service with a smile. And you know great service wants me to spend mo money: Americano done right plus five times the pastry selection compared to Bello. I don't plan to patronize Bello any longer. Au revoir. Tata.  Sayonara.  Peace out.  See ya hate to be ya.
author: hatraq c.

description: Very nice place to relax. Two types of chai and enjoyable baked goods. Can get snug on weekends with all the people
author: Nick R.

description:
Bello's the next stop on my renewed coffee shop excursion. The shop has ample seating and free wifi! Best of all, they accept credit cards!  Overall, Bello offered a great study / chill environment because it's not too loud but there's enough people to keep me awake. Other perks:

+ Drinks: I ordered the Cold Brew ($3.50) and a Lychee Iced Tea ($2.30). The Cold Brew was a pretty bold medium roast (I think). It was a little too acidic but I really liked that they use light ice. The Lychee Iced Tea was made with infused tea instead of syrup which I love. I'm not much of a sweet drink person so unsweetened drinks are always a plus. 

+ Service: Simply kind and helpful. I can't expect much more than that! 

+ Location: Conveniently across the street from the Glen Park BART station!

You should give this coffee shop a try! I'll definitely be back.
author: Chris W.

description: If you like your $2 coffee nice and burned, this might be the place for you. Espresso drinks aren't much better. There's a grocery store down the block with far better coffee.
author: Prashant D.

description:
I always order the same thing med. cup of coffee and an apple pastry. The counter servers have began to know my order and ask me as I walk up if I,.. "would like room?" 

 Does this mean that everything is great here at Bello's? No, but I have watched many, many people ahead of me.. I watched the challenge to meet everybody's demands.. 

 I have seen what it looks like when employees don't care, if the Bello employees don't care it's unfortunate but understandable.. Glen Park you are a saucy mistress. I've listened to entitled chit chat, people who take up one table with 4 seats with themselves and their 3 bags of crap while others have to stand or leave.. I've watched people stand in the door way talking outside while their dogs tied to the bench stand in the way on the sidewalk.. 

 It's a coffee shop, people act like their life depends on it! 

 Regardless of anything else these guys work hard, I continue to respect what they do, which is make GREAT COFFEE... and serve the entitled masses..
author: James M.

description:
Maybe if the barista had answered my questions about the Chai (instead of giving me a blank look) I would have liked this place more. I really wanted to love it since it's so cute but there was just something about how unhappy (or maybe uncaffeinated?) every customer seemed that really turned me off.

Convenient location, though.
author: Steph D.

description:
I'm saddened to report this place, which used to be a favorite, continues to decline. The fake-tasting "cream cheese spread" continues, and the counter service -- always a bit hit and miss -- has gone from so-so to downright bad. The other day I went in for a weekend brunch and ordered a bagel, a slice of quiche and coffee. I place my order and stand their waiting with money in hand while the guy at the counter gets my quiche, which he needs to warm up, and stands their holding it while proceeding to engage in a long conversation with another patron about some sort of sound equipment they were comparing. All the time I'm standing there, not saying anything, but looking right at him hoping he'll notice he has a customer still waiting. Eventually he breaks off his conversation, rings me up and gets my coffee. Progress. But...

A few minutes later my bagel is ready, but not the quiche. That happens sometimes, so no big deal. As I start eating my bagel I hear the toaster oven in which they warm the quiche give its little bell signal that says it's done. No reaction from the counter staff. I wait a couple more minutes and clearly no one is paying attention to it -- both people on duty were taking other orders, etc. Finally, after a couple more minutes -- bagel almost done, coffee getting cold -- I get up and politely ask the second employee on duty, a young woman, if there was any sign of the quiche I'd ordered. She looks at the toaster oven, realizes it's ready, puts it on a plate and gives it to me without a word -- no "thank you for waiting," "sorry we got a bit behind," or anything of the sort.

I'm visiting this joint less and less often. It's a shame, as it's really convenient and used to be a favorite.
author: Bruce M.

description:
As other Yelpers have said, this place is "cute." In other words, it's small but not a shabby looking hole of a place. Seating isn't plentiful, which is to be expected of a neighborhood coffee shop.

My little cousin was in town and I wanted to take her to get coffee because she seems to like that kind of thing. The cashier was kind enough to take my request for my latte to have "the face" drawn in it as seen in the many pictures posted by other Yelpers (I also posted a picture).

 I'm not a coffee drinker, and I don't really have any objections to the selection they offered nor do I possess any mind-blowing insight into the it-thing to get if you chance a visit. 

What I can say is, the place seemed quiet and quaint. There was a small wooden bench outside and we leisurely sipped the away the silly mustached latte foam art under the soft sunshine.
author: Sam H.

description:
This place is super cute! There's not much seating, but there's certainly a variety of chairs. The menus are adorable with plenty of drawings and fun fonts. 

They also have awesome and easily accessible wi-fi, which I found to be super convenient. 

I had the Lavender White Chocolate Mocha, which was super delicious! I paid a little under $5 for a Medium, 16oz (I think) cup for "here". I'm not sure I could taste any lavender, but it was very white chocolate mocha. 

Overall, I may trek out to Glen Park to study in this hidden gem, if I ever want to get away from the chaos of busy SF.

P.S. One note was that the music got oddly loud at one point and I almost felt like I was at a club, but it was cool because it made me conscious of my surroundings, rather than just being a numbing atmosphere. Bello, thanks for switching things up and making me pay attention to your music choice!
author: Erika S.

description:
Walked here after brunch at Tyger's because I needed my caffeine for the day. Walked into this cute cafe. I ordered the lavender white mocha. 

Needless to say, I will be back. I'm glad there's a coffee shop by my house and it's walkable.
author: Jenna R.

description:
My favorite coffee spot in the area! Lavender white mocha is a must if you enjoy lattes. Their coffee is strong so no extra shots or anything is ever required here. They make everything perfectly proportional and depending who's working they will make a very cute design out of foam!  

The ambiance is nice but not really the most comfortable place to sit and study. Most of the comfy spots are usually taken and the other chairs are uncomfortable. I usually get my coffee to go anyways!
author: Heidi H.

description: I've been going every weekend for over a year and have loved the ritual of this cozy neighborhood spot.  Although I've always been disappointed there was never any friendly recognition as a regular or even a sense of general friendliness, but oh well, the drinks were good!.  But after a month or two of ordering cappuccinos that were no different than a latte, I am deciding to move on.  I've requested "less milk, extra foam", but it seems as if this is just a basic drink that they should do well, but don't.  I'm sad to go, but it's time...
author: jo c.

description:
Every time I come in here, every time, the baristas are rude. This past Friday a short, white, baldish guy literally looked like he was fuming.  I'm not exaggerating. He literally looked like he wanted to punch the wall.  Every subsequent person that walked in, he snapped at them too.

I want to like this coffee joint because I'm in the neighborhood but for two years now it's been an unpleasant experience with the people who work there. They are not happy to be there and it's your JOB to be at least pleasant (you don't have to kiss up) because you do work in Service. 

Hello? Owners? Do you not care about the people who represent your establishment? 
Just boggles my mind.
author: P K.

description:
Wow!  I'm really impressed!  I am very particular about my coffee... my philosophy is that an espresso drink should...well...taste like espresso.  Sounds simple, but 99% of coffee shops tend to put a lot of stuff in their drinks that just end up masking the flavor instead of complimenting it.  Upon walking into the quaint little coffee shop I see a large and perfectly maintained roaster to the right of the entrance. This quickly filled me with hope because any coffee shop that takes the time and effort to roast their own bean in store generally take the time to blend and balance their different espresso drinks.  The second ray of hope is when I see on the menu that all drinks are made with double shots of espresso.

I quickly order at small White Mocha and wow, easy 5 out of 5!  The espresso flavor was strong and bold with a nice roasted earthiness right off the bat.  The white mocha flavor is there as an accent at the finish adding more of a rich creamy flavor instead of a sugary one.  Perfectly balanced!  It really doesn't get much better than this. .Also handy dandy are the optional non spill lids.  You know they must cost the coffee shop extra but you can tell they spare no expense for a great experience. http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/AeAZNgLKYX3BiRMaeHwCOA/l.jpg

This ranks up there next to The Conservatory of Coffee in LA as my favorite coffee spots.
author: Rob P.

description: Came here with friends a while back. It's a nice, cute coffee shop. First time getting a latte with art, so I was pretty excited. The vanilla rose latte was a miss for me. The chai latte and green tea latte were better. A star off as well because they ran out of mugs...the barista had to wash my cup from a pile of unwashed dishes and cups in the sink..in front of me. But the art was really pretty and service was decent.
author: Joanne H.

description: Love the vanilla rose latte! my favorite coffee/study hub! thank you, i hope one of the barista can instead make a coffee in a nice cup with latte art
author: Taryn M.

description: There wasn't any decaf coffee  but this place is great for an average working person or student to sit and relax after a long day. It is easy to commute to this area since it is right next to the 44 + 54 muni line and Bart. I wish the sitting area would be a little bigger because it could get really packed.
author: Brian B.

description: Bad service with crappy attitude. Made the wrong drink and went out of his way to make it my fault. No offer to make the right drink. I wouldn't go back.
author: Steve R.

description:
My friends and I stopped by this coffee shop on a chilly afternoon for hot drinks. We wanted to order drinks and sip inside. The "barista" informed us that there were no clean cups. He didn't even offered to wash any of them. What kind of coffee shop doesn't have clean cups?!

The "barista" informed us that he was not knowledgeable about any of the tea choices because "I do not drink tea." He tossed the canisters  on the counter for us to smell the tea choices. This "barista" needs a serious customer service crash course. The coffee tasted bitter and was not hot.

We were visiting from Boston and will not be returning. #Save your money.
author: Kelly A.

description: Bello is located conveniently next to the Glen Park bart station so it's perfect for commuters looking for an amazing pick-me-up in the morning.  All the drinks I have had (lattes, iced tea, mochas & coffee) have been consistently great.  I live in LA now (where coffee just sucks) and everytime I come to SF, I have to make a stop here.  The cafe is very clean and has a really welcoming homey vibe.  Service has been great as well.  Employees truly care about the drinks they make and they are very friendly.  Last time I went they had a new cold brewed coffee machine set up.  The cold brewed coffee (very reasonably priced btw) comes in a cup with actual iced coffee ice cubes so the drink is not watered down!  The employee told me it takes 12 hours to make one gallon!  Definitely try it out!
author: Jasmine L.

description:
This definitely beats the corporate coffee pimps.

If you ever need to stay awake to document amazing places on Yelp at 1:00AM, then a double shot from this place does the trick.

+ Really good music 
+ Clean
+ Crowded
+ Happy atmosphere
+ Very reasonable prices
author: Ryan K.

description: Update: Bello responded to my feedback and gave me a full refund. So update to 3 stars for good customer service. Hope they also get the quality of their coffe back on track!
author: R Y.

description: Today I watched the cashier run his hands through his hair, rubs at his eyes, and basically touch every part of his body prior to grabbing bagels with those same bare hands. I haven't seen this cashier before at this location (an elder Asian man, not the young guys and girls that I typically see) but I won't be ordering food from him until he takes a basic course on food sanitation.
author: Scott B.

description:
My old neighborhood coffee shop when I lived in Glen Park.

The service was usually quick, the nommables tasty and I really only received bad service once when I asked for the closest thing to a frappachino and was told the ice cream store across the way.

...

Yeeah.

Even so I'd still recommend it, it was one of the honey's fav places.
author: Meg T.

description: This is a place to relax, pull out a book, and enjoy something delightfully caffeinated.  There's no rush and there are plenty of plugs for any work or manuscript you might be itching to finish outside of the house.  Located not far from Glen Park Bart station, it offers a small place to spend time whether alone or with friends.  Worthy of a try.
author: Angela K.

description: Mixed feelings about this place. The coffee is in a very small portion to make it "sustainable" and was expensive. That being said, the barista was friendly and the design of this place with hanging glass lighting and a long curving wooden table give it a creative and chill vibe. It was also relatively empty to sit in so probably a nice place to do some work and have some quiet (this was around 9am on a weekday).
author: Lauren K.

description:
My bf wanted to find a new place for coffee since we always go to four barrel and what lead me here was the high ratings on yelp. Sadly, this place was a let down.

We ordered the green tea latte and regular latte. The green tea latte just tasted like foam and cream. It was just okay but the latte was disgusting . It tasted like the bottom of the pot with high acidity and burnt grounds.

I don't see why people like this place . The environment was cool and there was one barista but she seemed overwhelmed and cranky.
author: Amber H.

description: Ordered three lattes and a muffin. Nice vibe and good coffee options. Will definitely go back.
author: Alanna F.

description: I like the lay our of this coffee shop . Friendly employees . Free wifi . Great strong coffee ! I got the lavender white mocha . Usually come here with my wife . She enjoys this place too . Parking sucks but it's also conveniently near Bart also . Seating could be hard to find but plenty of it . Would definitely come back here .
author: d n.

description: This review is solely for the vanilla rose latte. All my favorite flavors combined into one drink= a dangerous and expensive new addiction! Its the perfect blend of flavors and perfect for a warm SF day. The cafe itself is really cozy...ample seating and fast service. My new go to spot for an afternoon pick me up!
author: Samantha S.

description: They have been making me a perfect soy latte for three years. Thanks Bello!
author: S. Z.

description:
Delicious Chai Tea Latte!! The snack selection was not that great. My cousin got a regular cafe latte and that was also very tasty.

The latte art is cute :)
author: Carina M.

description:
I had some time to kill, so I stopped in side of Bello Coffee & Tea. It's very much your neighborhood coffee place. I saw many people run into people they knew and kick back and talk for a few minutes. The staff is laid back and everything seems very familiar, despite never having been there before. 

The vanilla rose latte is EXTREMELY GOOD. It's a fresh take on a vanilla latte that has a refreshing sweet kick in addition to smelling super good. Not something I thought I wanted, but I definitely do. I want it all the time. I have dreams about this. Wish I was in Glen Park more often. They also looked like they had really tasty looking treats to offer as well. But, man, that latte. What's it doing tonight?
author: Sam D.

description:
This is my favorite place to get coffee in Glen Park. They brew an excellent espresso and are always super friendly. Their iced americano is one of the best I've ever had too, the perfect drink for those rare hot mornings in SF.

There is free wifi and several chairs and tables to relax at while you enjoy your drink. The rotating art displays are also always very interesting and add character to an already cool space.

Their tea is also very good and they have a wide selection of iced teas of various flavors. They have an assortment of pastries, but their coffee is the reason to visit.
author: Scott C.

description: Well I'm probably going to be a regular here from now on. Service is always great. Must try their lattes! I tried the lavender white mocha (a little sweet, but full of flavor!)
author: Angela L.

description:
Enjoyers of ice coffee beware!

We stopped by yesterday for pick-me-ups. I had an iced lychee tea which was quite nice and grabbed an iced coffee for my husb. Y-u-c-k! It was easily the worst iced coffee I've ever tasted. Bitter would be an understatement. I should have returned it but my family was waiting in the car so I doctored it as best as I could. If ever we return it will only be for tea. Parking is a mess.
author: Maria G.

description:
This is the best Danish my mouth has ever encountered. It's crunchy, not overly sweet. Got cafe au lait because I didn't realize until after that they had flavored options. Next time for sure. 
Good ambiance, got a corner table with a view of the street. Nice cloudy day.
author: Marcela M.

description:
First off, if you the tall slender barista is in, you are in for a show. Her constant and non-stop banter with customers about pretty much anything is is both endearing and entertaining.

This is a great local cafe, the coffee great tasting and the service always excellent. The only down side is that this is not really a hang-out and work kind of place with crowded table set-up.  Granted the library is right nextdoor, but for those of us who work and support the local cafe scene, a few more outlets would be great.
author: Bruce R.

description: Coffee is ok but I just bought a pastry that was not fresh at all. Should have been in the day old pile. I'm cool off this spot.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Cute! Like all the other people's reviews are saying about this place! Awesome coffee shop, with plenty of seating, around 20 or so. There's higher tables (bar like) and there regular tables as well as some sofa (single person sofa!) in the back for seating! Wifi is free and fast :) which is a plus! Came here on a saturday afternoon, and still plenty of seats, definitely different from the college towns I'm used to. There's just little things around this cafe that sticks out to me. Like the fact they have a tiny ass table just for someone to put 1 cup next to a sofa.. so you don't have to put your drink on the floor. 

The barista was super friendly, helped me out to what I should get. Tried to create a cool latte art, but it looked like a butt, but whatevs. Cappuccino was amazing and their latte also looked bomb! Typical cafe foods, like quiche, scones, cookies, brownies, coffeecakes. 

Def coming back again if I'm ever nearby! Very close to Glen Park Bart too! Parking's expensive if you're paying meter. I suggest you park residential and just walk.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Great Latte here. I was a little disappointed in the latte art on mine, it wasn't as pretty. Heh, but all the same with the lid on.

I also had a blueberry crumble cake that was fantastic! Good thing they didn't list the calories or I probably wouldn't have got it. But if you treating yourself, try it!
author: Alex K.

description:
Bello is my jam. When people ask, "Hey Dan, what is your favorite coffee joint in San Francisco?", I know they expect me to say something like Four Barrels, Ritual, or Sightglass. Instead, I say, "BELLO IN GLEN PARK."

It's true. This cafe has it all. I love their drip. I love their lattes. I love their mochas. They have good seating (when there's space). Glen Park is beautiful. Usually, the music they play is quite excellent and at worst, it's not terrible. One time, some 80's heavy metal blared over the speakers. It seemed oddly appropriate. 

All in all, Bello is a gem in a neighborhood of a gem that is Glen Park. Highly recommend.
author: Dan K.

description:
The best latte in the city, hands down! Every time I go! 

Delicious pastries, great tea, great baristas who are really good at their jobs. I love Bello in every way. I was talking to another customer one day, and she said it was the second best espresso she had had IN THE US, which I thought was fantastic.  I guess she drinks a lot of espresso!

I just have to add, the reviewer Ashley K said the lattes were "too milky" and tasted  "watered down"... I'm wondering why she didn't order hers in a short cup? That would keep the ratio of espresso to milk at roughly one to one? Or order a Cortado? Or a Macchiato? The fabulous baristas at Bello have heard of any espresso drink known to man. They can make it stronger, girl. Trust me. Don't knock the biz cause you don't know how to order!
author: D M.

description: Ive been going here for over many of years...I live in the neighborhood and this is the best place for coffee and lattes etc. Great customer service.
author: Braddah Rick M.

description:
Small but quirky and unique coffee place here in Glen Park. They seem to specialize in coffee drinks and selling whole beans. They also do a cone dripped coffee here which had been the local craze lately. The interior is comfy with armchairs for laptop surfers to tables for groups to chat. There arr a bunch of light fixtures in here that hang down from the ceiling with colored bulbs on the end...very cool looking!

There are a bunch of food items on the counter that I noticed, one of them being a chocolate cream cupcake.  I ordered an iced mocha when I was here. But since I saw so many order coffee, I think I will try it next time I'm here.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Previous reviews may have skewed my expectations for this place.  

I came by to grab a coffee before I heading back to Merced this morning and so I yelped coffee shops looking for something near the freeway/on my way to cross the bridge.  

I was just going to get a regular latte, but then I decided to try something that seemed unique to this establishment, so I got the vanilla rose latte (16 oz /medium, $3.90).  My latte came out fairly quickly, which was nice..and it smelled good!  But once I tried it, I was unimpressed.  The vanilla rose syrup was very over-powering and much too sweet.  I guess I could have ordered less syrup, but I didn't know.  I wanted to taste more of the coffee flavor and less syrup/milk combination.  I couldn't even finish it.

So meh, this place is whatever based on the coffee alone.  Other things I did like though in the 10 minutes I was there were: 

*location - near the freeway, decent area, next to a nice little market, found parking easily
*inside - nice decor, not too small, some seating, clean
*fast service
*price - not expensive
*they have food - bagels, muffins, breakfast pastries (empanada-like things?), croissants, and I think I saw quiches 


I'd give it another try, but based on my first visit and judging heavily on the latte I ordered, this place was okay.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Cute shop! On a sunny corner right off the BART. I was coming from the airport and getting ready to walk to a friend's place but wanted something to eat. Walked in here, saw the usual bevy of people on computers engaged in what I will stereotypically call startup conversations, got a pastry, some coffee, and was happy. Sat by the window, watched the beautiful day go by (I believe this is in the sunny part of SF - WIN) and relaxed. This place is pretty great.

Went back to the counter later and asked for another suggestion, was helped out, and all was good.
author: Mark K.

description: Love this place for more reasons than just it's good, easy, convenient location. Coffee is good. Nice variety of seating options for the space-tables, club chairs or countertop. Everyone in there is always pleasant-staff and clients. Lots of food holding and table clearing and smiling by patrons. Cute "kid"(he's not really a kid but Cute Guy felt a little creepy from someone who could probably be his mother) with great hair and a beanie always makes me smile too.
author: S Blair P.

description: I might be addicted to their green tea latte! I always get mine with almond milk but they also have soy and coconut milk options if you're dairy free. I love the atmosphere and supporting a local business. I'm not a coffee drinker but the smell of the freshly roasted beans is intoxicating. They also have an awesome loose leaf tea selection.  I always send out of towners here (since it's right down the street) and everyone is always impressed. Plus, the drinks are just so pretty!
author: Michaele K.

description:
Staff - knowledgeable, friendly, quirky
Place - accessible by BART, buslines, 280
Can get busy during commute hours, but in the off-peak hours it is a great place to hang out.
Free wifi.
I always get the white chocolate mocha or their seasonal teas.
Highly recommended.
author: Conrad A.

description:
This place is much cheaper than other coffee places I've been to when ordering a latte, not to mention they are pretty good at doing latte art here. Their lattes come automatically with a double shot so it gives you plenty of caffeine to keep you running for the rest of the day. The latte was nice and smooth and it was not overpowered by the milk.

Side note, they have these coffee lids that comes with a little latch to close the hole when you're on the go which is very convenient!
author: Spencer E.

description:
Oh how I love SF!

I love that every corner has a Mom&Pop coffee house that serves WAY better drinks than Starbucks (which exist at every corner in LA). Bummer!

Anyway, I had their Mocha two days in a row and it's really delicious. No excessive sugar taste or abdominal pain and/or bloating after you finish it. The café itself is very quaint and small; I don't recommend it for studying purposes. Staff is friendly and very quick to make the drinks given the long lines. Loved it!
author: Anna N.

description: GREAT lattes- strong and harsh very western style. But the foam is perfect! They have super strong iced coffee too that they make slow drip.
author: Liza S.

description:
Favorite coffee spot so far. The vanilla rose latte and the lavender white mocha are so aromatic and unique. Its the perfect way to start your day or for that extra kick midday. Being only 10 minutes away, its a convenient location and the staff is always friendly. Seating average for a coffee shop and never full.
Prices are reasonable and theyre open early!
author: Veronica L.

description:
Ever since I moved to Glen Park in April of this year, I have fallen in love with this neighborhood.  Each time that I have come into Bello Coffe  & Tea I have been amazed at how friendly and genuine the baristas are to their patrons.  

They have treats and a bit of food to pick from as well.  I chose this neighborhood carefully as I wanted a place away from the hustle and bustle of the city.  I've brought my friends from the city to this cafe to eat drink and be merry because I love the ambiance so much.

I will continually come here and recommend this establishment as you can get great food, coffee/tea and simply get work done. 

I've only had one poor experience with one of the employees, Liz, who was having an off day for sure.  She greeted me with an exasperated, "What can I get for you" and then showed irritation when I asked for the Wifi password.  I'm sure there are a lot of folks that come in here ordering next to nothing and hanging around for wifi? but assuming that on someone who is a regular is probably not good judgement.  Anyhow, one bad experience out of the many good ones so def not a big deal!
author: Katherine P.

description: Got the vanilla latte. Good taste. Their coffee tastes like it is french pressed which is a plus(has a rich dark chocolate taste to me). The bagel I ate with cream cheese either was super dry in general based on its ingredients or it was old(not sure so didn't star based on that(stars based on coffee).
author: Matthew F.

description:
I was walking around Glen Park on New Year's Day and nothing was open. Lame! But this place was so I wandered in with a friend. 

I had their tropical lychee iced tea and it was amazing. So so good. 

I really want to go back and try their rose vanilla latte. It looked so good but I'm staying away from coffee for a while. I'm all about tea for now. 

But this place is super quaint and looks like a rad place for a coffee date or a good place to read a book. Usually you can't find a coffee shop that would be good for both. 

I was impressed. I like this place and I'm definitely going to check it out again.
author: Heather J.

description: I really love the coffee here.  It's my go to morning cup.  I'd give them 5 stars if they had a little better attitude.  They never seem to be in a good mood.
author: Gary M.

description:
Average coffee, teas, and other drinks; tastes more like something you'd make at home.  Not much of a coffee person, I usually go for the teas, but have had a couple hot chocolates and blended iced coffees.  This place is more a spot to sit down and pass the time while waiting for your next bus, BART train, or other brief stops in-between commute/running errands.  Very friendly staff but this aside, I'd gather the popularity and sustainability of this places lies in its convenient commuter location.

Another downer is the music (and volume). Its subject to change depending on each barista's personal preference.  The most indigestible selection is the continuous blasting of Hard Metal.  Imagine sitting at a small conference room-sized space trying to hear your own thoughts while writing an email, chatting, or just grinding out thoughts for your next paper/project, with hard Hard Metal blaring in the background at a volume of 5+.  To each their own but its ultimately a coffee shop.  I want to enjoy my drink, thoughts, and the scene without having to feel like I'm in a Hollywood exorcism scene.
author: Honest J.

description: This place is not the best best coffee shop in the Glen Park area. I won't come back here. Came here with my mom and got a brownie pastry here. It was ok. I would come back here if it becomes a Philz Coffee. Only gave it two stars because the brownie was alright.
author: Isaac H.

description: It had been a bad night, and a bad morning, causing me to rush out the door without any breakfast. And catching multiple forms of public transit doesn't give one much time for error. Bello was my saving grace this morning. Essentially across the street from the Bart station, it was first super convenient. The staff was very friendly and the bar was full of pastries for my choosing. They did not have cream cheese today for my bagel, for which they were apologetic and offered other options, and the latte I ordered came up fast and was pretty good. I think I was there less than five minutes and caught my second bus. Definitely recommend.
author: Meggie D.

description:
This is my favorite cafe in the Glen Park neighborhood. Good coffee in a cozy environment with friendly (and skilled) baristas. 

Warm and inviting shop for those who want to work, catch-up with a friend, or pick up their daily cup of coffee. A variety of sweet and savory goodies. Sit-down tables, bar stools, and couches. 

My current favorite is the chocolate-y brownie (or two or three) to go with my fresh cup of cafe au lait!
author: Bonnie S.

description: Killer little coffee shop. Love the fact they have green tea Matcha. If you are looking for Matcha, this is the place to go! Good luck, and Cheers!
author: Dave B.

description:
IN NEED  OF MY HOT BEVERAGE!!!!
(3.75 stars)

On the (no caffeine) hot cocoa routine. I need a life if I'm amazed over their disposable lids having a flip-slip-cover (never seen that before). I can cover the opening or uncover it whenever I want. So Bart friendly (if you know what i mean)!!!!!

- beverage & pastries, yum
- prices, fair
- service, wonderful
- ambiance, typical cafe

M - F, gym at 5:30am, park my car at Glen Park neighborhood, stop in Bello coffee, and hope on the bart and be at work before 9:30AM. I feel like I'm starting to be a regular. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

Butter pound cake ($1.65) - i love pound cake of all shapes and size. Extremly love Bello's butter pound cake, it's so moist and fresh. Goes perfect with a hot beverage.

Hot cocoa ($2.45) - I'm very picky with my hotcocoa. starbucks cocoa gets me all bloated and gasy. Everywhere else is too sweet and syrupy. But at bello's its perfect! I feel like they've read my palate and know how to make it.

Italian Soda ($2.70) - Had the raspberry. Not feeling it too much as i've had much better italian soda elsewhere. 

Will I be back? M - F for my morning hot beverage fix.

Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
Why is heavy metal music blaring at 10am on a Saturday morning?  Thats great that the owners/baristas are into it but you may want to think about your customers...

Bagel is average but green tea is good.
author: Sandhya K.

description: Love this place, it's right down the way from the house, cute decor, great coffee and a friendly staff!
author: Ash M.

description:
Hidden Gem in Glen Park:
I had a few minutes before meeting friends and walked around the Glen Park BART Station.  I found this sign that listed Italian coffees and then tea.  The name of the place was Bello Coffee & Tea.  If a coffeehouse dares to list tea with coffee, then I find it a challenge to see if their teas measure up.  I entered the shop and was drenched in a song by The Smiths.  I was home.

The decor is contemporary with cushy lounge chairs, bar and stools, less cushy chairs and tables.  The service was quick and courteous.  I was served by a SF Giants fan, goatee and all.  He was most friendly and welcoming.

I was delighted to find a good list of white, green, oolong, black and herbal teas. Coffeehouses do not always offer such an array of tea.  Bello even had 2 different oolongs for my choosing.  I decided to try the Iron Goddess of Mercy oolong hot tea.  The food choices were not extensive so I settled for an oatmeal nut cookie.  For my taste the honey was too much and too sweet, but the whole grains were good.

The indie rock rounded out my brunch time making the morning a wonderous and surprising delight.

If you are ever at the Glen Park BART Station and need a break or pick me up, I highly recommend visiting the Cafe Bello for tea and a treat.  You may even get lucky and hear a song by The Smiths (How Soon is Now?).
author: Audrey C.

description:
Unpretenious all the way around.  Coffee is quite good.  Service is thankfully unfussy--efficient, but friendly.  Wi-Fi is very reliable. The interior would never make into Architectural Digest, but it serves the purpose.  

The problem is really the lack of tables. It feels like a proto-miracle when I can score one. I do like to work at cafes and I often have to bypass Bello for a place were there's an available seat. First-world problems, I suppose. However, when I do manage to score a table, it's a lovely place to work. The clientele is quirky, thankfully short on entitled Tech types and hipsters. 

Sadly they recently moved up their closing time by an hour.  Hopefully that is not a bad omen.  

Great neighborhood spot with great coffee and a feeling of real SF authenticity.
author: Matthew T.

description:
its alright. solid wifi. iced coffee was bitter. 
but the thing that gave it 3 starts only was the weird music. some weird rock or something... definitely not coffee shop music and it ruined the vibe.
author: Kevin E.

description: Super friendly and talented baristas. Awesome coffee. The perfect Monday morning cure.
author: Pranav N.

description:
Great coffee, great atmosphere. Depending on the time of the day, might be a line to get your order or free table. The best coffee beans (Brazil Santos and Sumatra.)

//
author: Kim K.

description:
I just moved to SF after 5 years in the peninsula and I'm glad this coffee shop is a block away from my new place!

I first went for a mocha, then a sausage pasty, and today an iced mocha. All 3 are winners! Definitely definitely get a pasty because it's pretty cheap for $3 and balances those sweet mochas.

I judged the iced mocha to be slurpable because it was so good! Of course then I ask myself why I downed a drink full of caffeine and sugar in 30 seconds as I become all jittery.

And the interior is cozy and welcoming, so check it out when you're in Glen Park: it's 50 yards away from the BART and 44 Muni line.
author: Josh O.

description: I've been coming to Bello for several years now.  Not only is this place always filled with pleasant people, great baristas and run by two charming owners, it's the best coffee in town!  Countless times I take that first sip of a latte and am blown away by how good it is.  I love this place.
author: Loren J.

description:
Hmmm. The conch face behind the counter this morning was the antithesis of service. Pretend you're going for an interview before you grace their threshold. Prepare and mentally rehearse any unforeseen questions. She WILL ask you. She WILL proceed to make you feel inadequate, slow, and worthless when your response isn't immediate.

The guy was pleasant. His coffee delicious. 
5 stars because everyone has a morning. Maybe she hasn't had her breve yet.
author: Ben P.

description: I've only tried the latte and while I'd still rather go to blue bottle, it's definitely good and the location is hard to beat!  I spent the afternoon on my computer working on a few projects.  It can get pretty busy in the late afternoon with all the commuters coming back and people running errands in the area (there are a few banks, grocery store, restaurants within a one-block radius) so parking can be very tricky.
author: Lisa W.

description:
This is bay far the best coffee shop I. The Glen Park neighborhood. 

They really care about quality. Their lattes are perfect and always include 'late art' which just adds to the fun.

I've been coming here for about seven years, at least once a week and often more.    Ambience is great.  Staff are friendly, and most have been here for years.

Come I and enjoy!
author: William N.

description:
yup. best latte in the city, hands down. I love Bello. better than blue bottle or any of the others. just go already.

oh, and the staff should be commended. they are amazing! friendly, NOT rude (ahem, like SO many other coffee shops) and they actually SMILE. I'm not kidding. so refreshing!
author: J R.

description:
Friendly, quick service behind the counter. 
Delicious organic and single region coffees. Beans roasted everyday. 
Cute girls always smiling and making the customers feel special! Woohoo!
Good music from dubstep to Tom Waits to Jazz to Indie classics.
Lots of regulars, it feels like an episode of Cheers. 
Fast & free internet.

Tell Andrew what art you want to see on the foam from triple hearts, leaves, skull & crossbones, and flowers. He once made a unicorn with rainbow coming out of its mouth! No kidding. 

All the baristas know how to do pretty cool latte art. I'm excited to come into Cafe Bello everyday. :)
author: Madison K.

description:
Best French Roast coffee in the city. I rarely get anything else.

I love going here in the mornings, it's just crowded enough such that you have a good chance of getting a table, and the service is fast. The service in the afternoons can be very slow, because often there's only one person working behind the counter during the slower hours. So if you are going to go there in an off hour, prepare yourself to spend some time.

Also the choice of music is awesome. This morning it was Danzig mixed in with some other stuff.
author: Chris T.

description:
I have meetings here every Saturday, and the staff is always cheerful and pleasant.  Bello has convenient access, mere steps away from the Glen Park BART.  With a nice seating arrangement, and good power access, this is a nice spot to park for a bit.

And then there's the coffee.  A great mix of flavors, and a giant grinder right out front means you can be sure of some fresh coffee every time you stop by.  There is even a healthy supply of tea for every occasion.

5/5 Would visit again.
author: Hamilton C.

description: My favorite coffee shop in Glen Park. They roast their own beans, and make a great cappuccino. It can get busy at rush hour, and a great treat before getting to in work by Bart.
author: Jean-Max V.

description: Good strong coffee, comfortable place, great neighborhood. I always stop at Bello when in town. Recommended.
author: michael r.

description: They have a nice selection of specialty drinks. We tried the lavender mocha, which was tasty. I will say that it is an acquired taste, as the lavender is pretty strong. I will definitely come back and try the rose late.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Nice atmosphere of a quaint neighborhood cafe but 2 stars for inconsistant quality. (As a mild disclaimer, I'm very particular with espresso drinks, so this might be harsher than more casual drinkers)

I've been here three times and two of them the cappuccino I ordered was sad and flaccid, however, once it came out perfectly silky. This isn't much an argument on the different schools of thought of foam. I like both the textured milk approach as well as people that just give a thick velvety head (giggity). However, foam goes very wrong when it's made of large bubbles that either start falling apart immediately or just sit there and leave you with hot milk and expresso.

Speaking of espresso. I also find their espresso to be a bit over roasted without many other complex or caramel flavors that I like.

Enough of my espresso snobbery...I do have hope for this nice litte cafe. They have a lot going for them if they can only improve the consistency between their baristas
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I've been here a few times already, mainly just because it's conveniently located right next to the Bart station. I really like the atmosphere and somehow I always overhear heated political conversations there. I guess it's a sign of the times? 

The teas that I've tried (mainly green teas) are awesome. You should definitely take a look at their collection.

The best thing is the free wifi and the atmosphere (am I repeating myself?).
author: Aka C.

description: This spot has a great little atmosphere. The iced coffee was okay. Nothing to brag about. Try something new here because that seems to be what they excel at. My husband got some mocha which he seemed to love. I kept it simple and got just a bitter tasting iced cofee. They get four stars because their service was great and it's a nice spot to leach off WiFi and hang for a little.
author: Kat L.

description: This place gets 4 stars because of the ambiance. Great little hipster place, chill calm vibes perfect for coming to do some reading or HW. Only thing is the service was a tad bit slow. Still nice little warm cozy spot to sip on some tea or coffee.
author: Savannah J.

description: Bello Coffee is a lovely coffee shop in Glen Park. I ordered a Sweet Chai Latte and a NY Crumble Cake and sat there for about 4 hours to study. I love this place! Free wifi, plenty of electrical outlets, and lots of seating space. I was lucky to have found a table available when I first walked in, but I can see that this place probably fills up sometimes. The latte was delicious and the barista was very nice. NY crumble was so buttery and delicious.. it definitely made me feel guilty afterwards. I also enjoyed the music that was played, definitely matched my taste!
author: Elaine N.

description: My boyfriend and I were in the area for the first time and I just happened to have a craving for some coffee. We saw the sign for this place and figured, "This looks cute, why not?" We were greeted immediately by the gentleman behind the cashier with a cheery "Hi there" and a smile. I bought a 12 oz green tea latte and my boyfriend got a 16 oz lavender white mocha (one of the specialty drinks). He quickly rang us up and made our drinks, which were heavenly. He was very accommodating of my lactose intolerance, offering me the options of soy or almond milk. My green tea latte was a perfect blend of the earthy tones of green tea and a touch of creamy from the soy milk. The lavender white mocha was a delightful surprise - an excellent blend of earthy lavender with the sweetness of a well-made white mocha. I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone who is in the area.
author: Janell C.

description: Great coffee & lattes here! It's in the cute little glen park neighborhood & situated by some really great local businesses (sol gym, canyon market...)!! The staff is always very nice & helpful when it comes to their coffee and your choice of beverage. They always create really cute latte art too!!! I posted a photo if my latte art of a little French man with a mustache! No joke! Definitely come in, get a drink, enjoy some free wifi and sit comfortably on their big leather lounge chairs!
author: Lacy C.

description: Good environment, spacious with higher ceiling. Some decent drink choices, may be on a sweeter side, but a good place to go for coffee lovers.
author: Michelle K.

description:
This place was highly rated in a "coffee drinkers" website, as well as The Best of the Bay in The Bay Guardian Weekly. I liked their Americano, and even the regular coffee. The beans they use is fantastic. The mocha was okay, and not because I didn't get a heart or leaf-shaped swirl design lol.

Near bart, and 280 or 101, it's not a go-out-of-your-way place. Located in a very inviting neighborhood/non-chain atmosphere where you'd want to go even if just passing by.
author: Peter L.

description: Gotta come to this cafe, if you like general rhythmic rap and lots of comfy chairs! Especially come if you wanna see some latte/ cappuccino ART coming from the barista working here. Yeeee! !
author: Michael A.

description:
This review is for the iced teas and hot teas.  I honestly was attracted to this place because of the decent list of tea I saw.  After making my way to the register, I asked about the tea and was told the iced ones are premade and the hot ones are tea bags and water from the boiler, so it's "not too hot" and I didn't need extra iced cubes.

They use a water dispenser much like the one I have at home -- it's an at-home water boiler!  Except, it's being used to fill my $2-3 cup of tea.  If your name has 'tea' in it, I would expect a little better like, hotter water at least?.  The iced teas are OK, but note, they're not sweetened and the cups are generally much too full of ice so your tea gets watered down quite quickly.
