At least it's a convenient stop after getting off of Bart at Glen Park, but I don't think I'll be back soon since Canyon Market and Rocket Swirl (or the latest named place) is so close by.

Restrooms were clean in the past and the staff is polite.  So on those notes, fine, but since this is a drink place, I do have expectations on drinkability. Meh.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco, the first thing I needed to find was a "home" coffee shop. Grocery stores could wait. Bars could wait. Heck, even gas stations could wait, but I NEEDED to find good coffee.

After much searching (which was made considerably easier thanks to yelp), I found Bello: exactly what I had dreamed of.

It's nestled in the quaint, picturesque heart of Glen Park, with a handful of other shops nearby, including a market that sells fresh flowers and produce. Sitting conveniently on the corner of Diamond and Bosworth, lined with huge trees and the bustling of passerbys, I couldn't think of a better place to spend my mornings.

Then, of course, there's the COFFEE.

First, my credentials: I love coffee. Pour me a cup of freshly brewed, black coffee and--granted it's any good--I can tell you which region it was grown in and the strength of the roast. In fact, the only thing I appreciate more than a cup of drip coffee is... Art. And well, if you're going to put art in a cup, I suppose I'll convert to espresso! Both the drip coffee and the espresso (and all subcategories therein) at Bello are absolutely perfect. Every. Single. Time.

Bello does all things well. Their breakfast items are scrumptious, their pastries delectable and their treats exquisite.

And, have I mentioned their COFFEE?
author: Kristi D.

description: The lattes here are great, but the ambience is a bit rough. The seating is usually limited, and I have often ended up at the bar seating. What tripped me up on a recent Saturday morning was the choice of music. It was appropriate for keeping the guys working behind the counter all fired up, but it was too harsh a choice for most everyone else in the café that morning. That's OK, I'll just take my delicious lattes to go from now on.
author: Patricia D.

description:
I had a meeting here yesterday morning, and arrived about 40 minutes early (driving from the south bay to SF, you're never really sure what traffic will be like).  The 3 barista's greeted me when I walked in, and I let them know that I would be ordering something, just not for a while, and they were fine with it.  I ended up ordering a soy cappucino and being an ex-barista, I can say hands down, best cap I've ever had (they even did the little heart in the middle of the foam).

The music, the atmosphere, the welcoming baristas...makes me wish I lived in Glen Park so I could go there more often!
author: ashley B.

description: I ordered a breakfast pasty. They heated it in a toaster oven (cool) but it tasted very bland. I asked if they had any hot sauce and the girl sadly said no. Apparently they have been trying to find a supplier for some type of sauce/seasoning but haven't found one yet. Bummer, it could have tasted great.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Everything about this place is good except for the workers I mean not all the works but the recent ones aren't really up to the job I remember last year belly cafe had a really good team Toney Jake and the other girl were really up to there job the coffee was great there was design on your latte they were quick friendly they were just awesome but now's team is just not up to it josh needs to find a solution..... the coffee still taste good so yeah I just have a problem with the workers
author: Jhon G.

description:
I hate to give bad reviews (and haven't given many, if any, yet) ... but my first experience was quite subpar, especially compared to other coffee shops out there with 4 or 5 stars. This is definitely not a 4.5 star place. Thing is, maybe they just had one off drink, but ... there are plenty of places in SF where they never make a bad drink.

First, place was a little dirty. The pastries and food options were pretty unimpressive and unappealing, sitting in a cold case. The barista made my latte and called me, but I guess I didn't hear him ... but I was sitting right in front of him and he walked by me a few times to do other things, so he could have been nice enough to drop it off. NOT that it should be expected, so I won't dock him for that.

But then he said something like "your latte's not getting any hotter," which was fine too, except that when I took a sip, the foam had dissipated (it had been sitting there no more than a few minutes), and it was still scalding hot!

Latte that is well made should hold its foam for awhile, and shouldn't be scalding hot even when it's first made. It might sound like a picky snobby thing to mention, but a well-made latte is smooth, velvety, and comfortably warm. So a scalding cup of thin liquid with bubbly soapy foam on top doesn't exactly fit the bill ...

Anyway, disappointing. Nothing really against the barista, he was nice enough actually. But just can't compete in this area where other shops go above and beyond, both in terms of service and in terms of quality.
author: J C.

description:
Cool little coffeehouse. They make a tasty chai and the baristas seem to take their craft seriously. 

I was happy to see that they recycle and compost.

Sort of an odd mix of patrons, probably due to BART across the street--college students, old-timers, cougars with their designer dogs, hippies and wannabe hippies,  the ubiquitous hipsters, and the occasional smelly homeless guy.
author: S B.

description: Great neighborhood coffee shop. Limited but nice seating, wifi, and a variety of snacks to keep you full. The espresso drinks are good, but I don't understand why they don't offer decaf options besides espresso drinks.
author: Karla R.

description: Everything is seriously busted in this cafe- the chairs (uncomfortable or ripped), the patrons (mostly disheveled), and the staff (unwelcoming and slow). Unfortunate, because given the location, it could be so much more! I don't normally review, but I'm commenting on the hope that the owner will take notice and improve things. Right now they dominate the market because there's simply nothing else around.
author: B W.

description:
Came into this place because it's close to the glen park Bart station, and I needed somewhere to hang out while waiting for a friend to meet me. The short version: coffee pretty good, pastry pretty bad, ambience and staff nice. 

Long version: The ambience is nice--it's small and got fairly modern furnishings. Music is an appropriate volume and a decent selection. No complaints there. It's quite full this morning with people on their laptops, which makes me think it's more for people working than it is for people meeting for coffee. 

The service was friendly and expedient. I got a 12 oz nonfat latte for 3.00. It was quite good but nothing to write home about. Very pretty heart latte art though if that appeals to you! 

I also got a breakfast fiesta pastry, which was pretty bad. It tasted like it had no salt added and the crust was waxy. So that drops a 3.75 star latte down to the 3 stars. I probably shouldn't have expected much from a pastry they stuck in the toaster, but it was barely above edible.
author: Meryl S.

description: I stopped in about 2 months ago and I have to say it delicious. I've been stopping in almost every day sense finding this location. My personal favorite drink at the moment from this location would be there White Mocha, its just the perfect blend and there whip-cream is just to die for. The location is small but very cozy and inviting and the staff is super friendly. I'm in love with this location and plan to keep stopping in as much as possible.
author: Sandra C.

description: This place is the real deal. Doesn't look great from the interior but the baristas know what their doing. Had the French Roast today for the first time in weeks and was blown away at how delicious it was.
author: Joel V.

description: Visiting the area for a few weeks and went hunting for my new coffee shop. I heard to try here instead of the others in town and was disappointed. The atmosphere is nothing special, only a few comfy chairs that were taken, & then your only choice is the awkward tables in the middle. Ordered a green tea latte (not a usual of mine) but I'm pretty sure it was just 2 scoops of powder in hot water. Nasty. I left and threw it away at the nearest trash can. Let the hunt continue...
author: Tasha M.

description: The coffee was alright, and the employees were a bit slow. Unfortunately, the bathroom was broken so I didn't stay long to study.
author: Amy L.

description: Ah finally a place with people real coffe and real good music playing , an A+ place .
author: James S.

description:
You can do better, Bello! 

Your interior is so charming, lots of art, a few couches and a really great vibe. 

The issue is your lattes. You serve lattes with so much milk I can't taste the reason I ordered it, the espresso! I've tried many times adding shots, but to no avail, they still taste watered down. 

I will say they claim to bake pastries themselves (I assume they come prepared) but I came in one morning "too early" for them, even though you were open. That made me sad. Had to eat a banana with my latte. 

I would come more often, but the sub-par latte keeps me away.
author: Ashley K.

description:
This place uses the best of everything~ 

Good coffee + good chocolate + good milk, you get an EXCELLENT mocha. Even their iced tea tastes so good. They also serve individually drip coffee. Definitely not just a regular coffee and tea shop.
author: Marlis T.

description: BART-friendly with gourmet espresso drinks and free wifi, Cafe Bello is hard to beat.  The big windows let in bright sun on nice days and the sunshine comes from the sweet, kind staff all the time.  I'm sipping on a superior latte as I type.  You know when the flavors are so sublime and divine as to be poetic?  That's what I'm talkin' 'bout!  Cafe Bello's drinks bring the flavor and foam art to that level all the time.  Great mix of chill customers of all ages and upbeat indie tunes for the hipper folks.  And you can take home their fresh roasted beans yourself.
author: Ted R.

description:
A medium, no whip, no foam white mocha please! :) 

I am in love with this little coffee shop! I will leave my house 10 minutes early on my way to school just to get my coffee fix here and it never disappoints! The staff is always super friendly and they almost always give you art on top of your coffee. They also provide like 30 different types of tea from green tea to black tea to fruit flavored tea, I have no idea what they're all called (thats how many they have)! haha! 

They also serve yummy pastries such as bagels, danishes, biscotti, madelines, muffins and croissants. I've never had them since I'm always in such a rush but they look good! They also serve day old pastries for a dollar. Along with regular pastries that most coffee shop serves, they also have veggie pizza and quiche which my boyfriend goes crazy over! 

I hear theres another location on Mission which I've never tried yet, but best believe I will if I'm in the neighborhood. :)
author: Jennifer L.

description: This coffee shop is optimized for the employees.  Heavy Metal music at 8am, check.  Every pastry wrapped in Saran Wrap to make you think it is a day old.  Espresso roasted to a burn.  Milk steamed to the boiling point.
author: Nicolas S.

description: The coffee drinks are decent here but kinda expensive for a neighborhood'y place. I've been to Bello 2-3 times and will not go there again, not because of the prices but because of the horrible acoustics and being an extremely noisy place, especially when parents bring their obnoxious crying or noisy babies into the place w/o regards for anyone else, not to mention that the doors or windows staying open all the time amplify the heavy traffic & outside noise.
author: Marc N.

description: Overall I wanted to like this place because I live in Glen Park, but the chai I ordered was bland, and the seating was very limited and uncomfortable.  The music is also super intense, blasting heavy metal.  If they improved their seating I'd definitely come back more.
author: Lisa B.

description: Just drove like 10 min because I read the reviews and figured it was worth it.  Although the staff is friendly, I was not happy with the food.  The quiches weren't cooked at all and the bacon was completely raw inside.  I almost threw up.  Go here if you want to but avoid the quiche! blehh
author: Jelena S.

description: Lavender White Chocolate Mocha, sweet but yummy.
author: Allyson L.

description:
The BEST coffee shop in the Glen Park area!  

THE COFFEE/TEA:  Consistently excellent coffee.  Single-drip coffee available after the morning rush.  The tea selection is fabulous -- green, black, red, herbal.  I've had nearly every kind of tea there and I have not been disappointed.  Right now, I'm on a black-lychee iced tea kick.  Mmm... so refreshing and perky.  

THE FOOD:  Great pastries that you can count on -- doughnuts, cookies, muffins, coffee cake, red velvet cake, lemon cake, bagels, etc.  Not "the best in the world," but always tasty.  For hot food, they have pasties and quiches that they can warm up.  If you're hungry for a meal, then this isn't the place to go.  If you want a little nibble with your coffee or tea, it's perfect.  

THE SERVICE:  Friendly baristas.  They do their jobs well; they're quick, personable, and skilled at makin' your coffee and tea just right.  They work hard!  I always tip them well.  

THE WIFI:  It's free!  But can sometimes be spotty when the cafe is too full.  It usually works fine when there are a handful of computers on the network.  There are some outlets available if your computer needs to recharge too.  

THE ATMOSPHERE:  Lots of tables, chairs, counters and stools.  Warm feel.  Not too hipstery, not too shabby, not too preppy.  Clean and comfy.  I always bus my table and put my dishes in the bin (by the trash), but some folks leave their dishes on the tables for the baristas to pick up.  They have bins for trash, liquid, compost, and recycling.  

THE BAD-ASS FACTOR:  Check out this clip of one of their baristas: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z4S5CuuolAk  

THE REGULARS:  There are a bunch of folks who come there every day.  Some of them keep to themselves.  Some of them are super weird.  Some of them are friendly and say "hi!" every time you see them.  It's kinda an awesome social experiment; very fun to watch.
author: thao n.

description: Besides looking good, the lattes taste great and the vibe is upbeat.   I love my daily commute and ritual of stopping in.
author: Zane A.

description: I'm on the fence about this place. They have a bathroom and wifi. There is also bart right there. You can find neighborhood parking there is also street parking. Place is okay and the prices are affordable! I got a bag of chamomile for 2.50 loose tea score! Right next to the glen park library too. They accept credit card too! password to wifi is latteart
author: Diane S.

description: There isn't much open for coffee in Glen Park before 10 AM on the weekends except for Bello.  The coffee is okay.  Perhaps you would be better served by ordering up a fancy latte or cappuccino instead of basic espresso.  The service can be a bit slow - even with only a handful of people inside.
author: Jean K.

description: Great coffee, pastries and service! Cute and cozy and perfect for a Sunday morning. I had a French toast coffee and a cinnamon pastry. Perrrfect!
author: Corissa K.

description: The coffee is good, the place is cool and the location is very convenient, price is kinda avg,, but service is a bit creepy I would say, not sure maybe the guy wasn't having a good day, just saying, otherwise I would give it 5 stars.
author: Shadi K.

description:
I love this place. Its very relaxing, comfortable and free internet.
Excellent customer service and very personable.
One of my favorites is their white mocha.
author: Christine H.

description:
This is my newest craving in Glen Park. Just past the Bart and next to my bus stop... stopping in here is convenient...but also delish!
They have plenty of seating for those who want to stop and sit for a while as well as super SUPER friendly staff. I like to sit and read the funnies. It's nice to be able to take some time for myself in this small but comfortable little shop.

I've never had to wait long also...for great artisan espresso, that's a treat.
They produce their own unique coffee...which is just super smooth and delicious
author: Katy A.

description: Super nice people working there! They are quick and their drinks are delicious! My favorites are the $2 peach teas and the white mocha. The white mocha has just the right  hint of sweet. I come every morning before I take bart.
author: Jessica F.

description: Best iced white mocha I've ever had in my life! Always friendly service... Has a back-in-the-good-ol'-days know your name feel. Delicious coffee, has chairs and tables so you can hang out and read, get work done, etc... A real gem in a gem of a neighborhood!
author: Kaliah C.

description: My wife is the coffee expert in this family in this case I'm just writing the review but she ordered a 16 ounce triple latte with whole milk it was pretty good except for one thing and that is it leaves a bitter aftertaste. Originally a 16 ounce cost $3.50 and includes two shots in this case for the extra shot they charge about $.90 including tax
author: Jerome W.

description:
Glen Park's Cafe Bello is a beacon of hope in a Starbuck decimated coffee market. Let me first preface this by stating that I'm not a coffee drinker. My beverage of choice is the chai latte, and I will search high and low for a good chai. 

I discovered this place almost by chance. I'm a daily BART commuter, and Glen Park is simply a brief layover on the trip. While waiting for the bus, I struck up a conversation with the lady I was standing next to. I asked her where you could get a good cup of coffee around here and she pointed me in the direction of Bello, literally just across the street. Little did I know that this would be the chai that I would measure all other against.

Bello offers two chai's, sweet or spicy. Not being in an adventurous mood, I stuck with the sweet. Wow, now that's not a Starbuck syrup laden knockoff, that my friends was the real thing! I was instantly hooked. What had turned into a passing cup of tea blossomed into a full addiction. Bello became a welcomed stop on the way to work.

After a few months and a couple dozen cup of chai, my adventurous spirit emerged from hiding. I  tried the spiced chai and hands down one of the best hot beverages I have ever tried. Those who fancy the likes of a true ginger beer or spiced foods will truly appreciate this beverage. 

So for those who like coffee, are into a good chai, or in the Glen Park neighborhood for that matter, give Cafe Bello a try.
author: Galen M.

description:
I've been a loyal Bellos patron ever since we moved to the neighborhood but sadly some of the new-hires aren't doing it for me. If I'm going to shell out 3-4 dollars on a latte, it should be better than what I make at home. They steam the milk too long, making it way too hot.  It ruins the foam and the flavor. Andrew is the best but I never seem to catch him on duty anymore.  : ( 

Maybe ya'll can have him train the two new guys?

The entire staff is super friendly though!
author: H.S. G.

description: Ice chai tea latte sweet is a must!!!!  .  Vanilla rose latte taste like a rose from heaven.  I wish I was lying
author: Danny G.

description: This place seems to have pretty good reviews, so I decided to check it out with a friend. After my experience there with the customer services I was very disappointed and will not be going back. When I walked in there, I wasn't greeted by anyone and waited a good 5 minutes until the lady (with green hair) walked out to help me. After she helped me and I took my change and she looked at me really funny expecting to me to add money into the tip jar. Which I would have if I was greeted on time with a warm welocme. What I found to not be right was the person that ordered after me got her drink first while I contunued to wait, funny thing is we got the same exact drink. I just don't think that was right, I am a paying customer and didn't cause any problems so why is it I was not treated with good customer service.
author: Sky P.

description:
Pros: The man working here was very nice. 

Cons: bathroom was pooped all over.. The radio had some game on obnoxiously loud, and the wifi was out.

Not a place to relax and/or study, but probably a good place for a coffee stop:)
author: Kroshka K.

description: I love this place! The staff are wonderful and make amazing drinks with steamed milk! The mocha is my personal favorite :)  They serve up a mean kid's hot chocolate for the younger crowd as well.  On top of that, the music is awesome and atmosphere is warm and friendly.
author: S T.

description: Bello still makes one of the best cappuccinos in the City and serves it for the best price. It's charming, independent, and at the center of the hidden gem that is Glen Park. Please go here.
author: Andrew K.

description: I was meeting a friend by Bart and I decided to pop in for a quick Mocha with whipped cream and I added a dash of cinnamon to top it off. Quickly headed out the door and took a sip. It was the best mocha I've had in a long time. Srsly, Glen Park does not mess around with their food selections. After I drained my delicious coffee, I open the lid and see that there are little bits of chocolate that didn't get melted. Also got a dark roast coffee for my friend and it was confirmed, they have good coffee.
author: Theresa D.

description: The barista was super friendly to my and my two friends! Made small convos with us an didn't mind our outgoing personalities. Nice enough to share with us a customers order that they didn't want and it was amazingly good!. I recommend anyone to this place for studying, socializing or just relaxing after a really long day :D
author: Akiko G.

description: For some reason, individual drip is only served after noon. The latte seems to be the thing to get here and it was pretty good for a latte, but I didn't get any latte art. I know it's a bonus, but there is such an emphasis put on it as noted on their website and by past patrons. So though my latte looked miserable, it tasted great. The big plus for this place is that they roast their own beans. You can buy bags to go for a pretty decent price. There are two locations as of now, the other being in the Mission. It's definitely a gem in the Glen Park area.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
We have a new champion of coffee in SF.  Granted, if you don't count places that are more about the food (Higher Grounds, Crepevine, etc), or chains, then I've really only been to Martha & Bros and Creighton's.  But still, this place is in a league of its own.

Yes, they do put a very fancy design in your foam, and while it technically doesn't matter, I expect there's a slight placebo effect.  That design makes you *expect* quality when you sip.  And quality you get...it wouldn't be a stretch to say that I didn't know coffee could taste like this.  The other thing that sets this place apart is the syrup--they know how to use it.  I had pretty much given up on syrup because they would always put in too much or too little, and in any event would never stir it in properly.  But the vanilla latte that my wife ordered here was the drink of gods.

Food-wise, you've got your basic assortments of pastries, pizza breads, and savory pies, all pretty solid.

The one complaint I could make is the ambience; it could do to be a bit brighter and cozier in here.  How about a skylight?
author: Wes M.

description:
Just moved to the neighborhood and WOW I'm so glad this little gem is within walking distance of my pad. 

Coffee is amazing quality and the perfect strength. Extra points for making every drink (no matter what size) with 2 shots of espresso, fancy swirls and heart designs in the latte foam and having decent pastries and food.

Love this place and I'd take it over the 'Bucks any day of the week.
author: Mama M.

description:
Whoa! Great latte, great food, great service. 

I personally liked the "Prepare for the Raptor" sign on May 21st, complete with an image of an angry dinosaur....
author: Jodie B.

description:
I wasn't coming in here for a while even though it is a scant couple of blocks from home. I suppose I was caught up in the puzzling draw of yuppie frenzy that is the coffee bar at (newish) Canyon Market a few doors down (aw, but I can purchase my coffee at the same time as my cardboard-boxed-expensive-as-hell-per-pound-salad!) 
Um, anyway, I went back to Bello one random morning, got a latte, and tasted what delicious is. Yes, this is what a simply satisfying, creamy-comforting, delicious coffee tastes like. I get the americano every once in a while too, which to me is rich and smooth - never bitter or burnt. Much better than the sometimes sour or bitter cups I get at the other place. 

Oh, also the baristas are really together, quick, and observant. One cold morning, due to lack of caffeine, my shaky fingers succeeded in knocking over my entire medium latte while trying to cover with a lid. I swore softly, blushed, and figured I would have to buy another. But before I could even turn around, one of the baristas had already made me a new one and came to mop up my mess even though the place was lousy with other customers! I loved that man at that moment.
author: Amy Jo J.

description: I've struggled, literally for a year (not really) on this rating. I like Bello. They have a good variety of coffee, good prices, generally friendly staff, and they do good artwork with the coffee, as many photos on this page show. However, the coffee itself is not meaningfully special. What I mean by that is I don't sit around at work thinking "dang I want a Bello breve right now.' And sometimes I do that with Caribou breves. So in that regard, it's a three-star. But the service and care given to the coffee warrant a four-star rating. Ultimately, I'm giving Bello the better rating because I want to encourage the care and artistry they put into their coffee, but I can't really say the coffee itself is worth writing home about, though it is the best in Glen Park.
author: David H.

description:
They serve the absolute best latte I have ever tasted.

And believe you me -- I have tasted me some lattes.

If this dude was in North Beach, he'd put the Italiani out of business. Good thing he isn't, cos the Italiani would in turn put him out of business. And business is good.
author: Chris R.

description:
I went there for the first time (7-24). This cafe is located near the freeway and the BART Station @  Glen Park. Every Monday, I feel like crap and wanna kill somebody. So I decide to get off the Monterey freeway exit and landed at this popular corner coffee-shop.

Parking was not a problem at that time. So I went in to this coffee shop. Surprisingly,one lady in front of me. Then My turn. 

The cashier,also very moody, asked me in a rude way,"Can I help you?"

I requested "Can I have a Depth Charge?"(Coffee and one shot of espesso)

So the barista made my espresso,while making my espresso, he cursed and argued with his associates. It have fear on my conscience.

After the the drink was completed, he rang up $1.95. I gave him a Ten-dollar-bill and requested changed for a dollar. I took a sip, and I felt a lot better and satisfied with this great-tasting coffee. I felt his pain on that tough Monday, so I gave him a dollar tip. Hopefully, he can use that dollar for a drink of his own.

$1.95 for depth-charge at this Cafe is the cheapest as oppose to other cafe which cost over $2.00. Great coffee and hopefully be back with a better attitude.
author: Matt G.

description:
My husband and I have been frequenting this coffee shop ever since we first moved to the Glen Park area 3 months ago. The baristas are always friendly and make cool leaf and heart designs in the foam of their lattes. The ambience is nice (especially near closing time when it is almost empty!). I have tried their vanilla lattes, chai lattes, and white mochas and all three have been consistently delectable.

I'm really glad to have this as a part of my new neighborhood after leaving all of the conveniences in Noe Valley.
author: Beth C.

description: Super yum coffee, super nice service, much wow, so happy.
author: Sonya Z.

description: What a lovely, cozy spot. Am from out of town and dropped in to grab a to-go coffee and get a taste of that famous SF mom and pop coffee scene. Was not disappointed. We got a lavender white chocolate mocha and were blown away! What a gentle, aromatic, delicate drink! Run right down and get one. I wish I'd grabbed a rose one too just to round out the experience. Have one for me!
author: Carlie A.

description: Great coffee shop. Punk rock and the Smiths playing, well made drinks (almond milk latte), lots of seating options with outlets, and open all day.
author: Ouroboros B.

description: It great that Glen Park has such a nice choice for premium Joe, none of which goes by the name of Starbucks or even Peets. Cafe Bello is highly rated and knowledgeable, yet comfortable and welcoming. And with all the specialty choices, Cafe Bello does plain strong black coffee just the way I like it.  The Latte heart is only a memorable icing on the cake.
author: Eric B.

description:
Great coffee, nice baristas and not starbucks. I go out of my way to grab coffee from bello. 
Excellent!
author: Francisca H.

description:
Loving myself some Bello Coffee! You can always expect a fresh cup of coffee as they continuously have freshly roasted coffee on hand.

Local small neighborhood coffee shop with a very laid back atmosphere.

The staff is super super friendly and answered all my questions regarding the coffee of the day.

Came in to get a cup of coffee and asked what kind of coffee was on hand. It was Indian Monsooned Malabar- This dry-processed coffee that's exposed to monsoon winds displays a unique taste profile: heavy on the palate with a peculiar muted acidity and malty or musty notes

Extra points to Bello for cutting down on waste. They provide silver mixing spoons to cut down on wasting those stupid wooden mixing sticks. They also provide raw suger, which is better than white processed sugar.

Next time I plan on trying a latte so I can experience the latte art for myself.
author: Cellina B.

description: This place is right down the street from where I live and has great coffee, a supreme snack (pecan chewy bar!), and sweet baristas. And I love it except for one thing: the music. It often plays heavy/death/thrash metal. I realize although I find this music completely nerve shredding lots of people like it, but I don't think they're the majority of the customers here. For the love of god please pick a less-metalic play list, or actually anything of the non-metal kind. Actually I'm here now and the initial thrash has been switched to Marvin Gaye so maybe things are on the upswing.
author: anna w.

description: Great coffee, friendly staff, and when you buy whole beans they give you free coffee. One time I bought beans but didn't want coffee and they gave me an iced tea instead. Accommodating and nice when I am confused about what type of coffee beans to buy LOL
author: Amanda W.

description:
I mostly buy roasted coffee beans there (I make my own espresso). The beans are always freshly roasted, excellent quality and reasonably priced. 

I use medium roasted beans for my espresso (which, in the rest of the world are considered dark roast beans).
author: eugene i.

description:
I owe this cafe a big thank you. Specifically the beautiful barista Audrina. I have been drinking coffee for 20 years now... and Ms. Audrina has personally saved me a lot of money and irritation by asking me one simple question(in regard to my chai latte): "would you like it sweet or spicy? 

WAIT STOP. Did you catch that? there's a difference. I never KNEW there were different kinds of chai! Do you have any idea how many lattes I've dropped $5 on, to take one sip- spit it out and toss it? I've never EVER been asked by anyone except Audrina that one simple question! I have been taught something very valuable by her. Now when I order my chai latte wherever I may be- I first ask is your chai sweet or spicy? If they say spicy, I know not to order it, and I can get something else that will make me smile :) 

Audrina- Thank you. You have literally saved me hundreds of dollars and allowed me to enjoy my cup of coffee the first time every time! I heart you! 

I'm also a big fan of the quiche here. Nom nom nom :)
author: maria K.

description:
Yea ok, granted, if friends are visiting me in the city, I'm probably going to take them somewhere "cute" like Coffee Bar...but Bello is a different animal. It's a neighborhood joint; totally unpretentious and serving a really solid cup of coffee. I find it's a great place to study because the playlist is fun but not too loud, the clientele is usually pretty quiet, and the wifi is fast and free.

I love places like Bello. It's a great alternative to the overrated corporate coffee temples and overpriced designer coffee boutiques.
author: Morgan L.

description:
I started packing my own school lunch in the 3th grade. I think my mom did not know how to deal with me being such a picky eater, so after countless morning arguments, she threw in the towel & said, "Fine, pick out whatever you want." 

When "planning" my meals, the one item I always had to have in my lunchbox was Hostess Coffee Crumb Cakes. Remember those? They came in a package of three & was the ultimate elementary school snack. They were perfection...well, Cafe Bello makes a grown up version & it kicks Hostess' sweet little ass! The yellow cake is moist & the topping is an unbelievable mix of cinnamon & strusel & brown sugar.

And their decaf iced white mochas are awesome-not a hint of bitterness that usually comes w/ ordering coffee decaf. (Btw, I order "decaf because the one time I didn't, I had the jitters for hours! Damn their full caffeinated beverages!) 

Cafe Bello is an adorable, clean cafe in the Glen Park area. I love all the natural sunlight that comes through their huge windows. Take a seat amongst laptop-wielding regulars who've found what they're looking for: a good cup of coffee & a wi-fi signal.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Had high hopes for this place but the coffee was not as good as expected.  Charming atmosphere and good customer service though.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I've frequented this cafe maybe 30 times (minimum) and finally decided to review. 

I love this place for:

- delicious, freshly roasted, and STRONG coffee. as someone who drinks three cups daily...trust me. Oh yes trust me.
- free wifi (though outlets are clustered in one spot)
- lovely staff


For those who plan on studying/quiet time:

- the (five) tables have a radius of my forearm, so keep that in mind before bringing your ginormous computers and textbooks.
- there's always eclectic background music (not blaring or intrusive but i know some prefer white noise)
- there are often small children roaming around, trying to make eye contact


Anyway, I depend on this place for my weekend happiness and productivity. The coffee here and atmosphere is more than enough to snap me out of my morning stupor and propel me to go out and do things, see people, be somewhat social...

- Caffeine addict
author: cecilia y.

description:
This place is great when it comes to lattes, coffee etc.  The staff is very friendly and the pastires are OK.

The only drawback is it is not the greatest place to hang out in and read a paper etc.  They get virtually zero sunlight in here and the lighting is not good so it is hard to sit here and read.  

Great to hit this place and go which I do every weekend.
author: Mark M.

description:
LOVE this place - great cafe all-around. 
The coffee is unique and rich in flavor. There are no pretentious baristas here, they are all friendly, knowledgeable, and super-efficient. Steady and fast WI-FI.

They sell the best almond biscotti here. TRY IT!
author: Annie L.

description: I LoVE this place. It's close to home and the atmosphere of the place allows me to get plenty of work done.  It's relaxing and a great place to sit down to catch up with a friend. The drinks are delicious. My usual is their lavender white mocha and hot chocolate...all topped with whip of course. =) The hubs get their coffee every time and loves it. the Baristas are super friendly and warm.
author: Uliej O.

description:
I experienced this godly latte when I was going to school at City College.  It's not walking distance, however if you have a car or scooter...highly recommended to take the time to go here EVERY DAY.

#1. The service here is fantastic.  All the girls who work here are so friendly.  It's quite wonderful to go to a coffee shop that has people who care about their customers.
#2. The location is wonderful.  Glen Park is such a cute little neighborhood to visit.  It's also right next to a health food market in case you don't want to invest in their pastries, head next door and get some yummy health food snack.
#3.  The coffee AND tea is fantastic.  I love that you can get a pot of tea or a cup of tea and it is not bitter.  THE LATTES ARE TO DIE FOR.  They always have lovely latte art and the foam is so thick it stays stuck to your cup till you get to the bottom.  Their lattes are strong and not milky, which is just the way I like it and their vanilla lattes are quite yummy as well. 
#4. It's a great place to study; lots of natural light, comfy chairs and tables and it's quiet for the most part.

This is probably one of my favorite coffee shops
author: Briezee P.

description: Usually a coffee bar is either a total hole in the wall with anonymous coffee or a coffee place with a reputation.  While I'd never heard of this place and only stopped in because it's the place in my 'hood that is on the way to BART, I rank this place amongst the better coffee places I know.  The coffee is consistently good, as is the chai latte.  If you're lucky enough to live in Glen Park or pass through, this place is definitely a worthy stop.
author: Marlena C.

description: A neighborhood gem where adults and some kids can hang out, use their laptops, read and hang with the commuters. The latte's are excellent and the coffee is wonderful. I prefer the French. Great music here too and is one of the few places where I keep my headphones off. Well done lads and ladies.
author: Moses G.

description: Love this place, opens earlier than any other coffee shop in Glen Park and makes better coffee than most of the fancier roasters in the City.
author: Mr. K.

description: Really great coffee. Perfect for a quick stop by. Their food is only ok. But great for a good coffee and a small pastry.
author: Sima S.

description:
It was so hot today that I drank THREE iced drinks at Cafe Bello today. 

1. Iced coffee: very nice. I asked her to fill it half way so I could fill the other half with milk. Very very nice. 

2. Iced green tea: lovely floral notes. 

3. Iced black lychee tea: mmm. It was beautiful. 

The pasty was okay... I think that it would have tasted better if I was s t a r v i n g. 

There was only one barrista working this afternoon and she was sweet and quick!

I like how the separate their garbage into compost, recycling, and garbage.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Cute little café which supplied me with some YUMMY iced coffee in the morning!!!! Do I need to say anything more??? :D Cute café, chill, people come to read and do some laptop work, and cute pastries as well.

I love how every district I've stayed in while in the city always has a cute coffee shop/café near by. mmMMmm. Glen Park, Sunset, Nohe/Castro, and probably others but that's all I can recall. There are so many areas!
author: CJ J.

description: I'm def a fan. Great spot to hang out. The baristas are friendly and they know their trade. You won't be disappointed.
author: M R.

description: This place never disappoints. It is the only actual coffee shop of the "coffee shops" around the Glen View BART.  It's the only place you come to get coffee and relax, or bring a group of friends, have a lively talk, etc.   Though seating is sparse, you can always find a niche in the refined space.  Coffee and espresso is decent, baristas are trained, tea's offered excellent, and lots of real bakery and bites.  A true coffee shop doesn't have a full grill with sandwich selection and stays true to itself. Bello manifico!
author: Eric J.

description:
3.5 close to 4.

I pass through the Glen Park area almost every day either by foot, bike, or car. I love to see Cafe Bello at different hours when the commuters are in and out, but also in the afternoons when the wi-fi catchers settle in. CB captures Glen Park in many ways, but I always feel it lacks identity because of this sort of customer turnover. The baristas are wonderful-- friendly and lively everyday, no matter what. But, the regular brewed coffee is inconsistent. I've had strong, bold flavors, but also weak, bitter cups here and that's what really keeps me from flocking to Cafe Bello on the regular. It's a great space, great location, and I'll be around!
author: Darryl W.

description: the 3 stars are for the owner and the muffins. the baristas are cranky and slightly scary.
author: Danielle M.

description: Although I am rarely in Glen Park I would stop in here for a quick coffee. Nothing special here but nothing bad either.
author: Dave B.

description:
I really enjoy the coffee these guys make!  Although, I'd really like to see them speed it up a little.  Chances are 99% of the people at this coffee shop, which is right next to a major BART station are going somewhere and are tight on time at 7:15am - a little more speed would make this nice little coffee shop PERFECT!

* Take a look at their inspection report (in the pictures) - 100!  Wow, only place in San Francisco I've ever seen with that.
author: Anthony B.

description:
Comfortable, peaceful, and relaxing cafe close to home. It is a good place to sip on some coffee and read a newspaper or browse the internet, since they do have free wifi. This place does serve a lot of locals and regulars, both young and old. It has an intimate feel to it and is usually on the quieter side, unlike starbucks. The baristas are warm and friendly and are very welcoming. 

And they create little works of art in your lattes and cappucinos!
author: Will T.

description:
It's just that they're soooooo slooooow.

I think a cafe near a major transit point (BART, MUNI) needs to pick up the pace a little. I always want coffee, and then I miss my bus.
author: Elena C.

description:
Love, love, love this place!  The coffee is pretty good, always super strong.  

Lattes are tasty--but, no matter how many times I say I want room, they always fill it to the top because of the art.

The tea here is also wonderful.  Love me some English Breakfast (best I've ever had) and the Peppermint  Rose.

If a train has recently let off anyone (or a bus), it can be busy in the mornings.  I skip on those days.  But, most of the time I can catch a lull.

My only complaint is the tall guy doesn't make my tea very strong.  But, all the baristas are super nice, and I love it!
author: Angela H.

description: I used to come here all the time. I like their espresso. I like the service too. The location is very convenient and serene.
author: J C.

description:
i love it here!! a totally relaxed coffee/tea shop with quality coffee, loose leaf teas, and blended drinks (and they roast their own beans). it's just the right balance of quiet / soft music (although one time one of their CDs started playing chris rock's EXTREMELY vulgar 10-minute monologue from "the blame game" and this VERY offended customer thought i was blasting it from my laptop lol) / soft conversations, and many customers lounge around on their laptops (there is free wi-fi!)

i like the counter seat facing the window to the street...i like sunlight and there is even an outlet right below...yes.  

i ordered a cappuccino and it is smooth, rich, with LOTS of foam, and comes in a big 12oz mug. i like!

and the loose leaf teas are excellent as well. white, green, black, oolong!

also, the big soft hunks of homemade crumb cake are ALWAYS beckoning to me.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This is definitely a neighborhood gem! I stopped by to duck out of the rain, after dropping off my fedex package. Starbucks got nothin' on Bello. The prices are similar, but it's always feels nicer to support a local business, instead of a giant franchise. (Especially after watching a Walmart documentary  -- *shakes fists*)

The cafe has a few tables, counter tops, free wifi, and outlets - a great place to cozy up and do some work. Clean, and modern, it almost feels like a Starbucks, but I'm pretty sure you can't order an Iced Mochafrappacookie shake.. Good choice of music too.. -- mellow indie rock.. 

My White Mocha was perfect with a small hint of sweetness. I hate when other places make it too damn sweet.. *gag*
author: Donna H.

description: In love with this place. There is nothing to not like. I think what makes this place so exceptional are the baristas. They really do make my visits pleasant. (I never engage in conversation, it's just the feeling I get from them.)
author: Lisa L.

description: They have traditional Oolong Tea which is my favorite! Free wifi is also helpful. The female staff is very gentle.
author: Kyoko T.

description: Love this place!  Great music!  Excellent customer service and WiFi rocks!  Laptop plug in situation is different but it works!  Would reccomend this place to everyone!  Loved the little trick or treats coming in for some sweets.
author: Salonje R.

description:
How do I sum of this establishment?

One big steaming coffee cup of MEH.
author: wayne s.

description:
this stuff is crack in a cup.  it's rocket fuel.  it's fdsfjxodrnwerweressssssome.


i finished my cup almost 2 hours ago and i'm still buzzin'.  how can i tell?  my leg won't stop shaking.  but regardless, this coffee is always expertly brewed and served with a smile.  i love this little local gem.
author: Ali L.

description:
I'm a coffee drinker, and I mean coffee coffee, no lattes or cappuccinos for me. This place is my neighborhood coffee shop and I hate getting coffee anywhere else because most places I've gone to have a very watered down flavor to their coffee. Cafe Bello roasts their beans in the back so that it's fresh, you can't even compare that to Starbucks or most other coffee shops.

Now I'm going to address a couple of the 1-2 star reviews that I find are for extremely dumb reasons. I will gladly defend this awesome cafe.

1. There were rubber gloves on the sidewalk in front of the cafe, therefore it's obvious that you shouldn't get coffee from there ever again. What the hell does that have to do with the quality of the coffee or their service? Really, get a life.

2. You had to wait 5 minutes for your drink. Heaven forbid. Clearly you've been affected by the "instant gratification epidemic" that has taken over our culture. And did you really time it? It might have been closer to 3 minutes but it just felt like 5. Again, get a life.

3. The hours of operation are inconvenient for you because you like to drink coffee in the evenings. Invest in a espresso machine so you could even drink a latte at 1am if that tickles your fancy.

Now back to the positive. Cafe Bello is the best coffee shop in this city. Period.
author: Jeremy V.

description:
Just a minor update, but Cafe Bello NOW accepts plastic money!  FIVE MORE stars!

So I guess this makes it a TEN star coffee shop!

I'm getting me a four shot latte or mocha after work.
author: Michael M.

description:
As a coffeeaholic, I've noticed that bad coffee days put me in a horrible mood.  I had several bad coffee days this week (mixed syrups one day, no refill during brunch the next day) but Cafe Bello saved my week and put me in a great mood.

Simply put, this is the best latte I've had in SF (and I went to Ritual Roasters last week and I've been to plenty of other places including Blue Bottle).  It was so good that it's painful to think of going back to average to good lattes.  The beans are roasted DAILY and the latte had a heart shape.  Looks aside, the latte reminded me of what really good lattes are supposed to be like - rich, deep flavor, smooth but strong, well-balanced, clean with no sour or bitter aftertaste.  They put two shots of espresso in their espresso drinks and they're reasonably priced ($3 for a medium).  

It's worth going out of your way for this latte.  Food wise, they had four types of pasties (British inspired meat pies) that looked good, loaf cakes, bagels, and cookies.  And they have gelato but they don't make that gelato. 

Too bad there's no free wi-fi but they sell some "designer" coffee mugs and coffee accessories and have some indoor seating.  I might have to start driving by before work.  A couple of months ago, I didn't even know where Glen Park was, though I had driven through several times.  I'm going to get to know it better now.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Happiness is stumbling upon a cute coffee shop - with friendly counter staff, truly FANTASTIC coffee, a clean restroom and one of my favorite Yelpers - in an unfamiliar part of town.  

By my count that's four stars.  Cool.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
If you find yourself with business at both Thurgood Marshall High School and Juvenile Hall on a Sunny day and have a break between your meetings, you may want to consider skipping a trip back to your office and instead working from this delightful little coffeehouse. There are yellow walls, nice art, a few plants here and there, and ambient music to make you forget all about the horrors and nightmares awaiting you on either end of your work day. (I'm kidding, btw- I love chaos and crisis).

The vibe is super mellow and the patrons are of the quiet bookish or laptop variety. The lights are really cool- they kind of hang really low from the ceiling (watch your head!), making it easy to read a newspaper, book, or psychiatric evaluation :)

The staff are super laid back and will let you hang out long after your iced quadruple shot Americano has been slurped up. There are also pastries that I can not eat but which look delish. For those of the savory persuasion, they have quiche, pasties (not the kind that you see at gold club *sigh*), and pizzas. Vegetarian options abound. 

Free WiFi means I can intend to get some work done and Yelp instead (sorry, boss!) and what more could a dedicated professional like me ask for?
author: Autumn K.

description:
Ok so back to to daily grind I went; that is work. I hoped out my car and instantly was hit by a gust of the smell of fresh coffee. 
I'm a mocha person so the white mocha with soy with an extra shot is my go to drink. The staff is super friendly (helps me when I need to perk myself up). 
Oh and they have gelato, that in itself makes me love this place...hello gelato di caffe (now to teach them how to make one)
author: Lola L.

description: This is GREAT coffee...along the lines of Blue Bottle and Four Barrel
author: Jonathan P.

description: Really cute, great coffee, will definitely be coming back :)
author: Daisy J.

description:
I get my coffee here on the way to work each morning, and I miss it when I don't have time or have spent the night somewhere other than my own neighborhood.

I LOVE their rotating blends.  India Monsoon one day, Ethiopian the next, etc.  

I feel they do quite a business in the morning, but even when there is a line the baristas get you in and out in a flash.

I've only hung out there a couple of times, but the patrons are always from all walks of life.  Construction workers, work-from-homers using the WiFi, students, even tourists.  Enjoy!!!
author: Dwayne A.

description:
Quaint, cozy spot in Glen Park. We were checking out some open houses in the neighborhood and I was craving a hot cup of chai. We stumbled upon Cafe Bello and decided to give it a shot. We stepped inside to find a clean, tastefully decorated space with plenty of seating, friendly service, and a nice mix of customers. I ordered a spicy chai latte and it was delicious. I believe the brand of chai they use is called "Ambiance." Whatever it was, I found it to be perfectly spicy and not too sweet, which is exactly what I was looking for. 

I was tempted by the baked goods, but managed to resist. They had some muffins, breads, and cakes that looked tasty. They also serve a few flavors of gelato. As we left Cafe Bello and decided to check out the local bookstore, I thought to myself, "Yes, I could most definitely live here."
author: Abby W.

description:
Let me just say that I have a little insider knowledge, as I used to work here.  My sister used to work here.  And a few friends have worked here as well.  The owner/operator Josh and Jane are decent folks that run a nice shop.  The one thing that strikes me about Cafe Bello compared to other places is that IT IS CLEAN.  The machines are sterilized each night, the floor is mopped once a day, the dishes on which the food in the refrigerator sits are washed every day.  The pastries are brought in fresh each morning from a local bakery at 5:00 AM.

Coffee - The drip (regular) coffee is always good.  Joshua (the owner) has very strict standards, and it pays off.  The coffee can't be served once it hits the 60 minute mark.  It gets dumped and a fresh pot made.  In the mornings, your coffee from grinding to drinking isn't even 20 minutes old.

Espresso drinks - Okay, so this depends on your barrista.  If it's someone new or someone on an off day, your cup might not be as good.  There is training, and the espresso drinks are usually quite good, but there's a chance you'll hit it on an off day.  If Joshua is making your drink, then you'll get a primo cup.  He's entered into latte art competitions, so you'll probably get a cool design in your latte or cappucino.

Food - Virtually all of it is from local sources.  Like the sweet breads are from a Glen Park bakery.  You'll find some packaged variety (like granola bars); those are obviously not made locally.  You can't get a "fill-me-up" meal here, but anything short of it can be accomplished.  Because it's right next to BART and MUNI (J, 23 lines et al), it's a convenient place to grab a coffee and a snack on the go.

Atmosphere - The music depends on who's working.  There used to be a staff of music snobs who would deliver obscure but tasty sounds whilst you drank your coffee (Mary, Marlon, Phoenix... ).  We no longer work there, but the music is still good when I visit.  The atmosphere is nice.  It's usually pretty well lit.  The place has a neighborhoody feel to it.

So bring a book, have a seat, and enjoy your caffeine.

Oh yeah, they roast their own morning coffee too.  It's got a high caffeine content.
author: Edward H.

description:
Awesome Organic Sumatra.
Really good lattes.
This place is my first stop on those early BART mornings.
Thank you Cafe Bello!
author: Geordie E.

description: Delicious lattes, natural sweet snacks/desserts. Love that it's local.
author: Shannon B.

description:
I am 100% sure that this is the best coffee shop in San Francisco. The coffee is so mothereffing good (why did I never try the Ethiopian before today?*), the crowd is delightful (delightful! what a pansy word, right?), the staff badical. I'm probably going to move to Glen Park because of Cafe Bello, no offense.

*Because I'm stupid
author: Shannon V.

description:
I recently moved up to Glen Park from Palo Alto (yay SF!), and have been looking for a replacement for Coupa Cafe, my favorite coffee shop in Palo Alto. Cafe Bello is like a tinier version of Coupa.

The seating is a little odd - a few small tables, several hair-salon-waiting-area-esque chairs that are not very conducive to eating or drinking anything that requires a table (I vote for some end tables!), and some counter seating at the front window.   

Pricing is very reasonable (although this may be because I only drink tea), and the tea selection is pretty good.  For good tea, you have to seek out these smaller independent coffee shops, because the big chains aren't really in it for the tea-drinking customers - except maybe Coffee Bean/Tea Leaf.  

Back on topic, Bello's savory pastries (breakfast "pasties," quiche, etc.) are delicious and super cheap.  A nice cup of tea and a giant wedge of quiche for under $4.00 fits very nicely into my non-profit worker budget.  This is definitely my neighborhood coffee spot for now.
author: Nisha P.

description:
Stopped in after a few hours of office work on a Saturday.  Ordered the white mocha with whipped cream.  Afraid it would arrive somewhat bland.  Overjoyed with each sip.  
The cafe was full of people but the place wasn't loud.  Remembered how I never wanted to live "outside of the City".  With each wipe of whipped cream off my lips I smiled at the neighborhood outside the window.
author: Colleen C.

description:
I order a large coffee for A. and a cappuccino for me... server calls me over after waiting for about 5 minutes... shhhh We don't have any more filters so I can't make the coffee... WHAT!! It's only 4:30...She makes him an Americano, he doesn't like it..

I give her 2 stars because I like my cappuccino.. 

If you're looking for coffee and this coffee house.. good luck!
author: Monica S.

description:
Ed. to the M nailed the clientle. This is my roommate's favorite destination for coffee. Normally when he says "I'm going to..." my response is lackluster and akin to "I give a damn why?" Here is how Cafe Bello changes that.

Roomie: "Going to get coffee"
Me: "Dude wait like 5 minutes for me to drop anything I'm doing right now and go with you." 

Then I stumble out of the house in sheer ecstatic joy.
author: Tyler W.

description: Love this place and their fresh beans. Te smell of freshness in the air. Baristas know what their doing, prices a bit high but worth it, abundant parking across the street in empty lot. once you taste their coffee its like a sip of heaven!
author: Cee B.

description: Consistently excellent. Great coffee, unassuming atmosphere, friendly, unpretentious staff. Orders are turned around fast, which is nice during the morning rush.
author: Julio A.

description: for the ninja barista jumping over the counter and chasing after the perp who stole the tip jar.
author: Pickle R.

description:
I LOVE CAFE BELLO BECAUSE:

The baristas know the difference between a latte and a cappuccino!
Best foam in my drink
Best tasting vanilla
Best tasting espresso
Best hearts, flowers and smiley faces on my drinks!

I look forward to the weekends so I can make the trek down to what I would call the best coffee place in the city!   


Note to the newbies....
Don't order a Tall or Grande it is called small, medium or large.
Don't stare at the menu FOREVER just to ask for "a cup of coffee" 
Get off your cellphone when ordering. 
Please pay cash, your plastic payment slows down the line and then you wont have cash to put in the tipping jar!  
Remember this is not STARBUCKS. Please realize that a good cup of coffee takes time and at cafe Bello is totally worth it!
author: Pattie s.

description:
Small white mocha with an extra shot of espresso (3 shots total) - delightful. 

 I want another!
author: Roxanne B.

description: You will not find a better mocha anywhere. If you don't live in the neighborhood and that is your drink of choice you may want to stay away because every other mocha from here on out will be a disappointment.
author: Mark F.

description: I usually get off of Muni in Glen Park, en-route to work. Before my short, BART ride (since it was still early), I went into this small, yet cute coffee place to grab coffee. I ended up ordering a latte. Boy, did I get a treat...a heart-shape on top! It's so unlike any other places. Yum! I'd have to go back to hang out there some time...
author: Annette L.

description:
Pretty standard type place.  Nothing unique.  I have had mixed experiences with their drinks--once, one was so awful I am sure she made it incorrectly accidentally (almost like they re-used already used espresso grinds), but I was too far down the highway to turn around.  I am fairly sure this was a fluke and they would have made me a new one.  Usually service is moderately speedy and drinks are decent.  The whole beans aren't too whippy, but the cakes are great! 

There is a much better place around the corner (next to  the french restaurant), but I forgot the name.. and the fancy grocery makes good drinks too, but the baristas are  kinda snotty.
author: Jorah N.

description: Comfortable seating, secured fast wifi, and great mochas! The music is not overly loud, which helps get work done while waiting out traffic.
author: Oleg P.

description:
Awesome coffee, but I always take it to go. Something about this place isn't inviting. Pretty sterile environment and not a lot of comfortable seating. Maybe I'm being picky, but this isn't a place I can picture sitting and reading. It's alright if you're with someone else, but when by myself, I end up leaving five minutes after I get my drink. 

Still, it is an awesome cup of coffee. Do yourself a favor and order a latte and behold the magic of swirly patterns while drinking beverages.
author: haley d.

description:
My brother turned me on to this place.  He gets his coffee by the pound there ($7.99 weekly specials that rotate!) and it is way good.  I too will buy my coffee from there once I move into my new place, but for now I'll enjoy bumming his coffee while surfing his couch.
The cappuccinos are great here, I'd agree with the other reviews that it is among the best in the city; dare I say I've ever had in my life.  Plus you gotta love the little designs they top off their espresso drinks, which are so many that I've never gotten the same design twice.  Although I was disappointed in my last design, it looked like a profile of a person but the artist had the shakes while doing it.  But design or no design, the coffee is still the best.
The staff is friendly and courteous.  Although in the wee hours of the morning, don't expect a conversation.  I guess everybody needs time to wake up, even java jockeys.
They have these inverted tea pots on display/for sale on the wall behind the register that I am curious how they work.  I don't want to buy one because I feel it will be a novelty item like the yard glass I currently have sitting in my house (aka my brothers' place) that is impossible to clean and just collects dust.
author: Dustin S.

description:
OK, they have hard-boiled eggs, and that makes me happy.

I already said their coffee is good, didn't I?
author: Premshree P.

description:
*********************************
I adore this place in my neighborhood of Glen Park!  This *is* the best coffee place for me by a long shot!  And it has permanently spoiled me for Starbucks and other chain's poor excuses for stimulating beverages.

Cafe Bello is such a cute and cozy coffee shop tucked right across the street from the Glen Park BART and so worth a rendezvous or a solo frequenting.  I wake up weekends lusting for my thick and creamy soy latte from this place and it delivers the perk-me-up I need PLUS the owner Josh and his staff are absolutely wonderful, friendly people to boot!  They are so pleasant when they take your order and remember what their regular customers prefer (I am 'large soy latte') so it's a true pleasure to patronize this business!!!  They even do quite clever latte art on the top!

All I can say is this is the only coffee shop I have practically unswerving loyalty too!  I don't remember having a less than stellar latte here.  And my only wish would be for expanded hours and cushier seating...but these are so minor requests considering how enthralled I am to be able to stroll to Bello from where I live!
author: Femita J.

description:
Everytime I've been here, it's been on my way to work, via BART. That means it's early morning. That means please can you get a move on so I am not late for work. Unfortunately everything always seems to take an age in here. I guess a lot of the clientele are in for the long haul, and so can afford to wait.

The coffee is good, the food is alright, it just needs to be a bit quicker!
author: bristol b.

description:
Cafe Bello is my Central Perk. They are graced with my semi-awake presence about twice a week when I can't get myself to make coffee before I go to work. I love this place.

First of all (and most importantly) the COFFEE IS FRESH AND GOOD TASTING!

2. They almost always have organic coffee on tap in addition to the french roast (i know that "on tap" is a phasing used for beer you idiot, but why not for coffee??!? Think about it...)

3. The people working there are friendly and actually have personalities (and although may not remember i order the same thing every time, notice when I change my hair). I have stood talking to the guy with long hair about burning man and peace protests for 20 minutes! (who needs to be to work on time?? not Molly!)

4.  It's near my house

5. I like it so much i felt there should be a #5. So shut up!





I'm feeling feisty today!


oh, and try the scones....yummy!
author: Molly W.

description:
I'll agree with everyone on the super fresh and oh-so-good coffee. And thanks to their cheap refills, I got to try their Ethiopia Harrar and Brazil in one very jittery sitting. 

One thing though--and this has got to be an automatic minus one star from--wifi coffee shops with only one power outlet are breaking the important rule of "stick around and enjoy multiple cups of coffee long after your computer battery has drained." 

I dig the location, though, as well as the musical selection. I feel like this place raided my iTunes playlist. The only time I've ever heard a soundtrack jump from Franz Ferdinand to Green Day to the Andrews Sisters is on my home computer. Makes my over-caffeinated legs want to get up and dance.
author: anne s.

description:
I don't like coffee but I'll write this review from my boyfriend's POV. He (Boyfriend) is a nut about this stuff and according to him, this place has the best espresso as any he's had. And trust me, boy drinks a lot of espresso. Baristas there are serious about their craft, unlike the local Starbucks that has the high school senior pressing buttons. All items made from their fresh roasted beans (roasted on-site), which according to Boyfriend are the best beans he's ever sampled. Not that he's sampled every bean roasted in the world, but he's tried a lot and this is the favorite in the Bay Area. The daily coffee selection is good too and his favorite beans-in-a-bag are the Brazillian and the House Special.

I'm too not partial to their baked goods selection, although the chocolate / cream cheese muffin is pretty good. They have your typical fare of quiche, scones and bagels, which comes with p'nut butter or cream chesse. I'm sure you're here asking about the coffee, not the pastries, but since I don't drink coffee, that's all I have to offer :(

Also Bello is owned by a Chinese dude. I'm all for supporting my fellow comrade.
author: Kat C.

description:
What a gem! I am an americano gulper. The Bello americano sets the bar as a perfect specimen: perfectly smooth and creamy, never bitter or muddy.  

Reasons why Cafe Bello makes me : ) 

The staff here, is fast,  friendly, and tight. They operate like a well oiled machine. You wont get their panties in a bunch by accidently ordering a venti. The add on bar is well stocked with every kind of sugar and stirer your heart could desire. Added bonus, the place is always spotless and tidy= ocd friendly : ) The music selection is never predictable, sometimes obscure, and sometimes nostalgic, but always varied. 

There is so much that is good about cafe bello... its difficult to stop.
author: Heather Y.

description:
love love love the heart in the latte.
they are super friendly
never too croweded
and have the tastiest beans. 

this week we are sampling colombian in the french press and it is heavenly

also the frequent bean buyer card is a big plus!
author: lisa w.

description:
Good coffee. 

I had no complaints about the decaf latte I had, in fact it was on the strong side and I liked it so. The cookie I had was pretty good and my friend said he liked his cream cheese-filled cupcake. We wanted to try their frozen coffee drinks because they are made with gelato, but their blender was broken. Unfortunate but it gives me a reason to return.

The woman working when we came (Friday Afternoon) was nice enough. There was a looooooooooooooong trail of uncollected customer receipts running from the cash register, which I thought was pretty quirky. It's a mom n pop type of cafe and it's also in Glenn Park, a plus if you want to have coffee with a friend and you want to keep it low key.

Drop by. Give it a try
author: Geralyn Y.

description: OMG i love this place!  I never knew it existed, but came here after looking up for coffee places around the neighborhood. I got the americano, which was incredibly smooth and strong. I love how they are green and provide metal spoons for stirring. I ESPECIALLY LOVE how they have brown sugar :) Reminds me of Mishka's in Davis. I need to come here more before I move away.
author: Fiona N.

description: This is my go to weekend early morning coffee joint.  I've never stayed to experience the "Friends" style couches or big mugs, but as far as lattes go, this place is money.  Everyone who works at Bello has always been pleasant and the coffee is just how I like my women.....ah, forget it, I'll get in trouble.
author: John C.

description: Absolutely perfect latte - as good as any bluebottleritual business. And a block from my house. Love.
author: Casey W.

description:
The staff here is always warm and friendly, the ambience is pleasantly comfortable, and my coffee drinks have always been perfectly prepared.  I'm giving it four instead of five stars (reluctantly -- I'd prefer 4.5!) because:
- It closes early :(
- The selection of food isn't great
- The drinks I order are more on the pricey side than I'd like.

With that said, I've particularly appreciated their mint mochas, and I also liked a gelatto drink with banana in it :)

P.S. -- I just noticed a sign on the register there which pleads with people to "please be polite" and when I asked, I was told by one of the baristas that he's personally had people yell at him to "work faster" and so on.   I swear, if I ever encounter people being jerky with the workers at this place, I will make sure to "accidentally" spill drink and/or food on them.  Or, no... that's too passive-aggressive.  I am determined to personally chew out anyone who gives lip or obnoxious attitude to kind serving staff folks.  You want fast and crappy, go to Micky D's (but don't yell at the workers there either, dangit!).

Whew.  Now I feel better.  Thanks :)
author: Adam L.

description: I've only had 2 cups of house coffee at Cafe Bello and I pass by the cafe almost every day.  The first cup was horrible.  Like battery acid.  The second cup was one of the best cups of coffee in recent memory. I asked Ms. barrista if it was fresh.  She said it was made 2 minutes ago.  Freshly brewed is important.
author: Bleep S.

description:
OH i love this place, the people are so friendly
but most importantly i love the little design they put on top with the foam 
its so cute as i glance at the top of my latte a few seconds ,
before stiring in the splenda.
and
they have so much little delicious things to eat 
slices of quich, muffins, & bagels
and ice cream/gelato:-*
author: Isabella T.

description:
Great coffee, friendly & fun service, and the ability to get in and out quickly. This is what I need in a pre-workday coffee shop!

I expected the hipster employees to be snobby and rude, but they are not at all. Almost all of them are personable and fun to talk to. And they can even figure out how to be friendly and efficient at the same time! What a concept... I love it. I usually only have 5-7 minutes between when I get off of BART and when I need to be at work and I know I can depend on Cafe Bello for my latte in that amount of time.

I love their drinks and the coffee beans. I'm working on earning my free pound of beans as we speak. Great tea selection, though I don't partake in that often. And a few flavors of gelato to boot!

Extra points for putting two shots in each drink. Yum.
author: Carmen B.

description:
Nice place by the Glen Park Bart station, the yellow walls light up nicely in a sunny afternoon

Had a latte here, quite strong. They say they roast their own beans, solid. $2.50

Their gelato blended drinks are intriguing, as in espresso over vanilla gelato, the best of both worlds? If anythin the gelato case gets cool points for a coffee shop. I've tried the "shaka bg", for banana and green tea (gelato). Wow, get it! Freakin awesome $3.15 (I do love bananas and whipped cream) - skip on "shaka mocha", I think "shaka latte" (espresso + vanilla vs chocolate gelato) might be better

The place has 5 tables (with chairs that are not very comfy) and a counter in the front corner with cushioned stools

Cash only (sux)
author: xo x.

description:
I'm a tea snob, so why would I go to a coffee shop for my dose of tea? Because it's served in an iron pot with high quality tea from Chinatown. Because it's brought to my table and the workers are incredibly nice. When I'm not in the mood for tea, the passion fruit Italian soda quenches my thirst or the mixed Chai (spicy and sweet) is warm love. 
Go on a Sunday, where it's more relaxed. I also really enjoy the pasties because they are tasty, filling and somewhat exotic. I totally feel safe going by myself. It's wonderful.
author: Jacqi M.

description:
I love Cafe Bello because it has great coffee, yummy pastries, and gelato! The setting and atmosphere is cool-dimly lit funky strobe lights and soft chill music. The place can get a little crowded and noisy but it doesn't get too overbearing. Overall a favorite place of mine to relax and read my books. 

I dutifully intend to try thier whole selection of baked goods. For the purpose of reviewing and to satisfy my sweet teeth.
author: C D.

description:
Great locals spot.  Coffee and espresso are some of the best I've had!  Their Guatemalan and Ethiopian house coffee come with high marks.  It's a great location, not noisy, spacious and every time I've been there (more than three times), I've always had great service and the employees are very nice.  Even with my god daughter toddler in tow who is just finding her voice:)  

Never had any problems here and love this place.  Highly recommend checking it out even once if you're in this area.  Definitely worth the stop!!
author: Kat M.

description:
Definitely my favorite local coffee shop.  They're pretty on top of their bean game, and devote a lot of time to sorting, roasting, and knowing a lot about their varied offerings.

The baristas are all pleasant and have pretty decent taste in music.  I've spent a good deal of time working there and have never had a problem with other clients, the wi-fi or the prices.  Keep going strong Bello!
author: Adam C.

description: Cafe Bello consistently makes the best soy latte of all time! I have been coming here since 2005 and am NEVER disappointed. The employees are all super friendly and no one can make milk froth look prettier - I always feel bad when I ruin my hearts and leaves by dumping sugar into my lattes. Plus, there are plenty of tables. This independent coffee house offers superb quality without pretentiousness.
author: M. D.

description: This place makes the best latte I've ever had. and the artwork in the foam is so nice!
author: Andrea A.

description: Love this place. Their beans are the best in town. Service is great too!
author: Laurie K.

description: I had a 7:00AM flight to the bay area and did not have my usual coffee start. Took the BART and to the bus stop en route to my friend's apartment. While waiting, I stopped by Cafe Bello, conveniently located by the bus stop. I'm glad I did. Service was fast. Helpful group of people and their espresso was quite strong. I'd love to try their cappuccino the next time I come back.
author: Joel C.

description: I love good coffee, but I also like consistency. That's why I'm always a little afraid when I go into a cafe. The first thing that hits you when you walk through the door is a delicious aroma of roasted beans. The staff is super friendly and doesn't try to rush you. Most importantly the coffee drinks are superb. It's the first time, in a long time, I've had a latte that wasn't killed with foam (HEY! If I wanted a cappuccino I would have ordered one). Anyway, although it's not in my hood ... great place to have a really good cup of coffee!
author: Sile O.

description: I love this place because it's on my way to bart, they have great coffee, the people are very friendly, they have a little compost bin for the wooden stirrers and almost everyday they have hard boiled eggs.  I also like their huge croissants, not too buttery to where you need 17 napkins but buttery enough that you feel slightly guilty.
author: Emily T.

description: Great coffee (Ethiopian today) and free wifi.
author: Andy M.

description: Hands Down this is my favorite non-chain coffee shop!  Great staff, great location, its nice and relaxing inside and they have really good coffee, espresso's and teas.  It's an ideal place to meet a friend over a cup of java to ketchup.
author: Michelle D.

description: I like this coffee and it is just a block or two from my house...so why don't I go here more often? The coffee is nice and strong and gives me the punch in the face I NEED in the morning! The other day my friend and I went in and the cute girl behind the counter put a heart in my latte foam. I was so excited until I saw the heart in my friends foam...IT WAS BIGGER!! Whatever, I'm gonna start going in the mornings on my way to work.
author: Kelly N.

description: Based on the cappuccino I had today, I'll be going down their menu list to try all their coffee and tea selections! One of the better cappuccinos I've had and its on par with Blue Bottle! Great atmosphere and friendly staff!
author: Vanessa W.

description: There is something about a non-chain cup of coffee that just makes it taste better.  Maybe its cuz I know that it came from the heart.  Maybe its cuz i actually had to explain why i didn't want foam on my latte.  (i just don't like having to work through the foam to get to my drink). The chain's are so used to hearing all the weird orders that its just normal.  Maybe its cuz they had both spicy and sweet chai.  Maybe its cuz their ice cubes looked like olives.  Maybe its cuz the guy at the counter was adorable, the place was tidy, and the bagel was delish.  I'm not sure for sure, but if i ever find myself in Glen Park again......you can count on seeing me here again.  Maybe.
author: Lauren F.

description:
