ok so the pastries here are still horrible, but after spending time in just about every other coffee shop in the city i have come to appreciate bello more.  the staff are all friendly (if at times clueless, the prices are lower than most places, the wifi is good, and there is lots of power outlets.  

while i have come to like this place, i STILL have not washed the HORRIBLE taste of that bad pastry from my mouth.  still, good job bello
author: john s.

description: Wow...what can i say. My latte had a swan shape and my wife had a smiley face. Best latte of my life as well. Mom and pop joint too, not a commercial chain. Fantastic.
author: Justin L.

description: First, I will start with what I like about this place. It's clean, and it's a space that makes you want to hang out for a while. I also like that it's in Glen Park, because you can pick up a coffee and go. I dislike that it's so small. It's more of a grab and go cafe. I came here to try and use their internet, but it was not working properly, and there was only one outlet for everyone to use. They need to get with the times!!!! Provide more outlets, and better internet service!!!!!  Also, I think that charging $2 for a 1/4 inch slice of banana bread is way too much $$$$.
author: Gabriel T.

description: Great coffee, but even better if the owner makes it for you.  He conjures up some magic that only he can when frothing the milk for your cappuccino, and I swear it not only looks better but tastes better. Eclectic music from 70's to jazz is played; a pretty sterile atmosphere, but clean and nice to do some work in; friendly staff in a cute neighborhood.
author: Yodel A.

description: Fairly standard neighborhood coffee shop.  They are conveniently located right near the BART station, so it's easy to stop there on the way too or from the BART.  I don't drink coffee, so I can only judge them on their hot chocolate.  It's good, but not the best I've ever had.  The cashiers were friendly and the inside is clean.  I recommend it if you're in the area, but don't go out of your way for it.
author: Chad H.

description: Friendly, cute baristas, average coffee. But unfortunately I can't come back here very often because their wifi has been flaky on two out of two visits. :-(
author: Stu M.

description: A friend and I visited Bello Coffee & Tea in Glenn Park neighborhood this afternoon for some catching up time and were so glad we did. It was delicious! I had the soy vanilla latte and she had a cafe latte, both excellent. It had such a smooth taste, just right. When enjoying your coffee in, you receive it in this very large coffee mug and the art, well, the Latte art is a must see, so creative and also serves a purpose. My friend even bought a lb. of freshly grounded coffee beans. What a great aroma, so fresh. Stop in, you won't regret it. I'll be back!!
author: Linda Y.

description: I post this as constructive criticism. I live in the neighborhood and want to like this place but after many visits since they opened, I've decided to call it quits. Others have called the staff "fast" and "tight." I find them to be slow, confused and mostly complaining to each other, in voices clearly heard by everyone in the place, about how overworked they are and how incompetent whoever worked before them was.  Last time I was there I placed my order and paid, then waited about five minutes. Finally, the woman behind the counter asked, "did you want to order something?" Hmmm....
author: Dan G.

description:
I enjoy coming here to get a cup of joe and surf the 'net, the latter which makes it easy to get sucked in and hang around for hours even though you've finished your drink long ago. Nice and relatively cozy environment (though the seating arrangement is a little odd and I semiregularly trip over chairs) and the food and drinks are delicious and reasonably priced. 

However, I do have to deduct a star because of the inconsistent staff. Some of them are friendly while others are indifferent to your presence. My personal favorite is the gentleman with a long ponytail (don't know his name, as no one on the premises wears nametags), but another barista with short curly hair and beard really needs to work on his customer service, as he regularly seems to look as if he'd rather be somewhere else. At least no one has artificial smiles plastered on their faces.

Quibbles aside, Cafe Bello is recommended for the anti-Starbucks crowd who believe in supporting local businesses, not to mention its convenient location (right across the street from BART). I moved to S.F. a few months ago and it's nice to have a place like this nearby.
author: Jon A.

description: OK, it was better the second time!!  First time I came and ordered a medium Americano.  Way too watery for some reason (missing a shot?)!  My buddy convinced me to give it another try since she gave it 5 stars on her review.  So we went back today for another try and had the mocha.  Will try the pasty next time!  I like the location since it is kind of in the middle of everywhere I go in the city and close to the freeway.  Parking is not bad if you don't mind walking a little for non meter parking.  Eggettes is across the street so got some options here!!!  I'll be back and next time, I'll remember the Netbook!!!
author: Ray Y.

description:
Ohno! I am short one measly quarter for 52-Excelsior. Hmm what to do, what to do? I decided to break free from yelp-paralysis and get a cup of coffee to warm my hands and procure some change. I was compelled to go into Cafe Bello because I was lazy and didn't want to cross the street. I don't drink coffee normally so I can't tell everyday bad coffee from everyday good/ok coffee. I can identify a significantly superior coffee and cafe bello serves it up. I have only had 2 such memorable brews, one here and one at Hal'i'maile General Store on Maui. The french roast was excellent and the guy at the counter was friendly and didn't rush me. I am planning to bring a mug anytime I have the chance to come here which will inevitably lead to coffee addiction. Everyone knows that coffee is the most common yet unrecognized gateway drug. 
Note: Yelp-paralysis- characterized by an inability to enter an establishment which has not been thoroughly researched on Yelp with a 4 or 5 star average rating.
author: JoAnna S.

description: I totally Heart this place, great coffee, great staff, and word is they have free wi-fi even BETTER =)  and it's right by the bart station, perfect spot for me to chill till my train gets in =P or if i Miss it gives me a place to feel sorry for myself but w/ a cup of joe =) woohoooo
author: Ryan M.

description:
I love cute little cafes and I discovered this one while I was walking around Glen Park looking for a place to study. I peeped my head into Cafe Bello and was immediately attracted to its quaint interior and (surprisingly) they were slappin bay music! I thought to myself "I guess I can just leave my ipod off then". So, I walked in and ordered a soy cappuccino and it was truly one of the best cappuccino's I've ever had! The espresso had a really nice full, deep flavor unlike Starbucks espresso (trust me, I work at Starbucks.) The foam was really creamy- a lot of baristas do not know how to make good foam! I topped my drink off with a good dosage of raw sugar aaaand yeah, I kind of wish I ordered a bigger size. After I got my caffeine fix, I decided I wanted to try more beverages and saw their HUGE selection of teas! I love tea! The barista was kind enough to take some time out to tell me about the different kind of black teas available and also let me smell some. I decided to go with the vanilla orchid black tea and a slice of pound cake, both of which turned out to be delicious! All of their pastries sounded amazing- even their savory ones! They offered vegetarian pizza, calzone type things, and a variety of quiche. How awesome is that? 
So, overall, awesome place to study, hang out with some friends or just have some chill alone time. Awesome espresso drinks and a wide variety of exotic teas along with sweet and savory pastries= my kind of place to be! Try it out, cheers!
author: De Ann W.

description: Free wi-fi! I'm in! The staff is friendly, especially the girl with the nose ring and the long hair. Their lattes are priced alright and taste great! You can really feel the kick in the coffee here! woo! Although they do not always do it, it is a nice touch when they take the time and create some latte art for you! This place DOES accept credit cards.
author: Derek H.

description: For an indie cafe and te' shop its the place to go besides Starsbucks, SB in Borders, and The Coffee Bean and Tea LEaf. Clean, Fast, and Convenient and
author: R C.

description: One of my favorite weekend neighborhood stops. The exterior has a very welcoming color scheme, so you can't help but be drawn in. The baristas are *VERY* friendly and attentive, and the coffee is good. Plus, they have gelato!!! This is a great place to start up a coversation with strangers, as I've had *MANY* political throwdowns with fellow patrons here! If you're used to Starbucks snobbery and sipping coffee in silence among yuppies, this place ain't for you.
author: Maurice R.

description: this is such a hip and cool coffee shop!  i love the muted brown colors, and the wooden percolator art piece on the wall.  the coffee is strong and tasty.  great music selection from every genre.
author: Sheri N.

description: Wonderful place to work/hang out.  Espresso drinks are typically very good, but occasionally burnt.  Very good prices on fresh roasted beans (usually pick up same-day roasts).  I've stopped visiting so often, though, because of intermittent wi-fi problems (note that you may need to download WinXP patches for WPA2 support, if you haven't done so already).
author: Ari M.

description: Not " One of my coffee joints " . In fact I don't really like this place . First , normally I go into any coffee shop and ask for a double latte' and they give it to me in  the "large " cup . Not here . They reply with what size ? That tells me the staff and / or owner worked at Starfucks or Pete's . Secondly they don't take $100 bills !! WTF ?!? $100 is a tank of gas , and you won't take it ?  Dude , get a haircut , get your head out of your ass , and make the coffee for christ sake !
author: Keyser S.

description: The cafe latte here is definitely worth the 1/2 hr. drive for me.. their creamy foam is the closes to one would find in Italy!
author: HRH S.

description: This is by far the best coffee shop in SF.  I'm not that big of a coffee person, but I LOVE their iced white chocolate mochas.  And my husband, who drinks more coffee than water agrees that this is his favorite place.  We love coming here Saturday mornings, it's a great way to start the weekend.  Oh,  just be sure to bring cash, they are cash only.
author: Nica W.

description: Simply one of the best latte in San Francisco. I've never tried their regular coffee since their rich and creamy latte has never failed me.
author: Makoto S.

description: SUPREME!!!   What an oasis in Glen Park village.  Excellent latte - everytime.  Highly recommended for the BART ride to work - yeah no drinks on BART - but this coffee is worth gettin' busted for.  And I agree the owner makes a killer latte!
author: Steven J.

description: F**k that Blue Bottle s**t, Cafe Bello is where it's at.  Plus, they do better designs in their froth.  The best coffee I've found so far in a non chain in the city hands down.  The only thing I find odd is how quickly their windows fog up...when they're closed.
author: Katie H.

description: I find myself gravitating to this cafe every week. It is located right off the Glen Park BART Station, tucked right behind the Citibank in the center of Glen Park Village. Parking in the area is not bad, there is a huge lot behind the building and street parking is readily available. The cafe itself is not pretentious and serves mainly the locals. A medium latte is $3 and topped famously with a latte foam art. I find the latte consistent and smooth. When I'm ready to move, I would want to move here, a block a way from this awesome cafe!
author: Phillip T.

description:
I recently started a search for cafes that are accessible from my house and enjoyable to work or read from. This brought me to Cafe Bello.

I like the service, food, and drink just fine. The music? French electronica-pop followed by Harry Belafonte - sweet! The chairs are a bit uncomfy and tables are tiny, but no biggie. So why only three stars?

Maybe it's just this afternoon, but this place is Kid Central. Every 15 minutes another mom with kid in tow comes in. The kids clamor for ice cream, they keep kicking my chair as they walk past, and they all have to play with the &^#$ fountain behind me until mom makes them knock it off, a dialogue that apparently must be conducted over my table. Then the hot chocolate gets spilled all over the floor. And then whining begins...

OK, I am clearly not a kid-person and am probably a jerk, but this is not the kind of cafe I want to hang at.
author: Ralph M.

description: The coffee is outstanding, staff is always friendly and it doesn't have the hipster/yuppie hype and thus, crowdedness of Ritual or Blue Bottle.  This makes for the best coffee experience.  Plus, they have gelato.
author: M M.

description: Solidly delicious coffee and a real gem for work mornings before hopping on the BART to the downtown coffee desert (although with a full-time Blue Bottle opening up in the Ferry Building, Cafe Bello may become a little less tempting).  The organic Ethiopian is yummy and they have tasty quiches, too.
author: Michael D.

description: I'm kind of a coffee pansy, I like a little coffee with my cream.  This is why my discovery of vanilla lattes a couple of years ago was so exciting.  Anyway, Cafe Bello makes the best vanilla lattes I've found so far (excluding Starbucks because I think they put crack in their drinks and that is cheating).  Added bonus, the baristas make cool art work in the foam of your drink.
author: Melissa G.

description: Great coffee, friendly staff, zero pretense, cheaper than Starbucks and Peet's, heart designs in your latte foam, ample seating, excellent selection of baked goodies, gelato... get it?
author: Alex C.

description: The BEST white chocolate mocha, not too sweet, just how I like it.  The staff is friendly and they remember your drink.
author: Teresa B.

description: My favorite spot in the neighborhood.  Good coffee, cute and for the most part I like the staff.  The owner is always there, and he makes the best cappuccino.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Great! Lovely coffee; texture and taste as good as the lattes found in North Beach's Trieste or Tartine's breakfast coffee bowls.
Cute staff, and I love the art on top of my short double cap. It's businesses like Cafe Bello that give me hope that one day Glen Park will become the new, hot place for folks to go for food and drink. Another gourmet ghetto? I'd welcome it so close to where I live.
I'll be back whether it's on the way to where I'm going--or not.
author: Jackie C.

description: Best coffee in Glen Park.  Period.  Only place I like the coffee better is Ritual..... but at ritual there is never anywhere to sit and everyone there is a yuppie trying to be cool with their macbook.  I like how at this place the clientele are glen park yuppies that have less of a need to be trendy than mission yuppies who are aging and desperately trying to cling to that last batch of coolness they made way back in 1995.  Trying to be cool when you're a yup is like a bald man wearing a combover.
author: Matt N.

description:
no stars because this place does NOT keep up the outside of the cafe....there is a pair of rubber gloves lying outside that were there Christmas Eve!!!  If they can't notice or care about 'curb appeal', I don't want their coffee.  They could clean up, if not 'spruce up' the planting area in front of their business.
Gross!
author: Vernon H.

description:
Unimpressed.  
Hours are inconvenient - I like coffee in the late afternoons and evenings especially on the weekends. 
Overpriced - my iced coffee came in a small mug for way to much money, and I believe the refill was the same price.
Atmosphere isn't overly comfortable - its a few chairs a a few tables and some barstools at the windows.  
Coffee isn't bad, but the live music last time I was there was so painfully bad.  I was kicking myself for not going to the mission or at least ordering my coffee to go.
author: Allison P.

description: The coffee was pretty good but the counter girl who initially seemed friendly got irritated when I told her she gave me the wrong change, which made me irritated.
author: Arptro H.

description: Great coffee shop!  I stopped by this afternoon to meet a friend and my mocha was very good.  The baristas were super friendly and the atmosphere is open and nice.  I like that they have recycling and compost receptacles as well.  I had a bagel but they also have some breakfast sandwich pastries and quiches that looked good.  Good coffee, good people.
author: K V.

description: I love Cafe Bello. it is small but great, they have a great service and most important their coffe is great. I have tried almost everything and so far my favority is their latte and the iced mocha. you should try it.
author: Flor C.

description: if the right person makes your latte, you are going to have a great morning.  if the wrong person makes your latte... well.  you aren't going to have a good morning.  you are going to be very sad.  in fact, your day might even be ruined.  but because this place is so adorable and cozy and warm, you will go back and take your chances again and again.
author: Samantha W.

description: stopped in yesterday for a latte. wish they had outdoor seating, but my coffee was decent and the woman behind the counter was SUPER-friendly. i noticed she chatted all her customers up, and was really sweet and engaging. it was a hot day and they didn't have fans or windows open, so it was a bit...muggy inside, but overall a place i'd go again.
author: Elle B.

description: I had wanted to go in for a long time and finally had the chance this morning, I am soooo glad. I had an almond pastry ( yummy) and a triple latte. The were kind enough to ask if I wanted the 4th spare shot and they even did a design with the foam! It was lovely! The place is cozy and the barisitas were really nice. This is a great first stop in the morning!
author: Krishawna F.

description: The daily special roast is a great bargain--a full pound of beans for $7.99, and you get a cup of coffee with it.  (The owner/manager usually lets me order a large, but the employees follow official policy and only give out a small.)
author: Peter L.

description:
i found a heart in my latte....that alone is enough to make me smile.

this is one of the closest coffee shops to my boyfriend's house and i love it.  they've got hooks right outside the door so i can latch my pup while i'm inside.  

the organic coffee is really good just plain.  so yay for cafe bello!
author: H. G.

description: this place is pretty cool but you can use a debit card and it kills me. the coffee is pretty good but some of the people that work there are sort of rude.but if im near here i go for coffee and its not bad
author: Mike L.

description: I really want to give this place 5 stars, but I cannot because of the service. I find it odd that there can be 3 people behind the counter, one washing dishes, another refilling the coffee pot and another making a cappucino, yet the two who are not helping people immediately choose to ignore (yes, ignore) the people standing in line. If they could just move a little quicker, perhaps not rely too heavily on their product they would have tremendous potential. It's a great place if you're not on the go.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Awesome drinks and great food.  If you don't know what you want, the staff will come up with something perfect for you.  Totally recommended.
author: Barry F.

description: Good coffee.  Great deals on coffee beans if you get the bean of the weak.  Try the lychee iced tea.
author: Christine N.

description: The BEST coffee in the city. OK *fine* Blue Bottle might be better, but Cafe Bello has none of the pretentiousness of that place. All espresso drinks come automatically with two shots, and man are they good. I've also never been to a coffee shop that consistently serves up a good foam like this place.  Plus, the staff has a pretty good sense of humor. For Holloween last year, they all dressed up like Starbucks assholes.
author: Anna L.

description: Oh how I love Cafe Bello.  The coffee is simply to die for, and how fun that they make little designs with the foam (yes, I am easily amused).  We're moving from Glen Park this weekend and that is one of the only things I'll miss.
author: Kelsey S.
